story:
#CreativeYouTube

The YouTube Creativity Course will be an online platform for anyone with a YouTube Channel. It will allow anyone with a YouTube channel to learn how to produce great content. Live courses, video tutorials & in-depth guides, made by experts & established YouTubers.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need your donations for:

  • Staff Costs: We want to do this from donations only - no ads or payments. We want to hire several experts for our support team - any user of the platform will have acces to someone that is always there for questions & advice.
  • Server & Website Costs: We want to make sure our website is fast and always online and for that we need your help. We will also hire a developer for mobile applications. 
  • Course Creation: After launch we want to have 1500 full courses with videos, live events, guides & assesment tests online right away. Over time we want to make lots more.

We strive to launch the best YouTube-related website ever. We truly appreciate your support! Even if we do not make the goal we will try to make the best possible out of it. We really appreciate your help though!

About CreativeYouTube.org

CreativeYouTube is an upcoming platform for YouTube creators. Anyone with a YouTube Channel can join. We provide every creator with one-to-one guidance and access to over 2500 guides & tutorials, all related to YouTube video creation. Every guide comes with information, video tutorials & regular live events. Once finished, you can take a test on the topic and receive an official certificate. 

Currently we are still in the process of starting up. We will definitely manage to go online, though we strongly depend on donations & funding from others. Feel free to support us on IndieGoGo!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word - invite others to support us!


    All perks include BETA access to the site before the official release.

story:
Help support the Lyric Foundation in building an interdisciplinary arts education program that combats homophobia, bullying, racism, and drug addiction.

The Lyric Foundation in Los Angeles, CA, is seeking funding to expand its arts educational programming with the objective of building an interdisciplinary arts program that combats social issues such as bullying, drug addiction, gender inequality, racism, and homophobia.  The objective is to provide students with exposure to multiple artistic disciplines and give tools to assist in dealing with deprecating social issues.  Funding in the amount of $250,000 is requested for training of the ensemble company members, the renting of a classroom facility, marketing, and resources for the classroom.

Statement of Need

According to a 2005 report by the Rand Corporation about the arts, "[Art] can connect people more deeply to the world and open then to new ways of seeing."  It has become increasingly evident that, due to No Child Left Behind, academic pressures have reduced arts education in the classroom.  In California, participation in music courses dropped 46 percent from 1999-2000 according to a study by the Music for All Foundation.  A study provided by SRI International found that 89 percent of California K-12 schools failed to offer a standards-based course of study for disciplines in music, visual arts, theater, and dance. 

Program Description

The Lyric Foundation is introducing, The Lyric Ensemble’s Summer Theatre Education Program.  This interdisciplinary arts program in association with the Lyric Theatre in Hollywood, California, is designed to train 80 students in the use of multi-disciplinary arts.  The ensemble members who have been trained in the use of the arts for personal and community empowerment will work with the summer students. The content of the productions, classes, and workshops are built around themes that combat different social issues such as prevention of drug addiction, racism, bullying and homophobia.

The ensemble members are local gifted LA artists, writers, musicians and dancers who are dedicating their lives to the training of underserved youth.  The power of the arts to support motivation to finish school, to expand their education and to be of service to their community is a goal that the ensemble members are modeling through their work in the ensemble. 

Goals & Objectives

The Lyric Ensemble is barrier-free, both physically and attitudinally.  We serve all people irrespective of age, geographic location, race, sex or socio-economic status.  We strive to level the playing field of life by accomplishing five main goals when working with traditionally underserved populations:

  • Providing multi-disciplinary guided exploration for children and adults in the theatre arts, music and art
  • Harnessing creativity to diminish or eliminate environmental barriers for all people
  • Training educators and professionals in the use of the arts as a teaching tool
  • Helping schools and children overcome barriers to achieving excellence in education and life goals
  • Influence policy makers, public and private to restore arts education to the schools

The Lyric Foundation's Educational History

The Lyric Foundation has a history of educational programming including the La Brea Barnstormers, a summer program for at risk youth. In this program children learned how to work together to perform in four live performances with costumes and sets of their design. The Barnstormers also enjoyed a number of workshops ranging from improvisation to stage combat and more. The program ran for 2 summers and enriched the lives of over 60 children.

Where Your Money Is Going

This budget includes funds for the training and staffing of the entire ensemble company, including Ryan Braun and Lyric Ensemble members, professional artists in residents who will be the instructors, production supplies, classroom space rental, necessary educational support materials, marketing, and the preparation and use of the Lyric Theatre for the final performance.

All donations go directly to the actual costs of the program, staff, and facility, and are TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

Don't have the big funds? You can still help!

  • Share this page with friends and family (see the share buttons above).
  • Add a comment (see “Comments” tab above). The more activity we have on our IndieGoGo page, the more visibility we’ll have!
  • Visit our website for more info: www.lyricfoundation.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello all! My name is Joshua and I'm a 26 year old acting graduate student. One of my earliest memories was watching Richard Burton in The Robe. I was fascinated with the precision of his words and how he inhabited his character. I quoted the movie so much, my parents took the tape away. From that moment on, I knew I wanted to study acting in the UK, but as a home-school kid from rural Virginia, I hadn't thought it was really possible..

In the spring of this year I had the pleasure of auditioning for my dream school, Birmingham City University, and found myself on the waiting list. Just a few weeks ago, I finally received my acceptance letter and my impossible dream started becoming a reality

There's just one complication: I have less than a month to pick up my life and move to a different continent, and I need your help to get me there.

A Little Bit About Me

My family moved to rural Virginia when I was 15 years old and home-schooled me and my siblings in their religious tradition. No one in my family had been to college before, but that wasn't an option for me. For me college was where you learned how to do what you wanted to do well, everyone looked up to as a child was educated. And so, I got my GED, spent two years in community college, and was eventually accepted by Radford University, where I double majored in Theatre and Music.

College was busy. I worked two jobs throughout my undergrad, sometimes taking upwards of 20 credit hours a semester. I took classes, attended rehearsals, acted in shows during the day, and worked throughout the night. But, my hard work paid off, and not only was I able to graduate, but I graduated with honors. Unfortunately, my parents have not helped me further my education, and did not even come to my university graduation.

Since that time, I have been working as a professional actor, musician, and writer in Atlanta, Georgia, including an Acting Apprenticeship at Atlanta's Horizon Theatre. Acting for me has never been about fame and fortune, it's about connecting with people by bringing stories to life. One of my fondest memories is from touring through rural Virginia with the University opera company. After a performance, a small boy came up to me. He was very shy, but wanted to tell me how much he loved the my character, the Dog-King. He said that he didn't understand everything in the show, but he was always happy when he saw the Dog-King, because the other characters were mean to the dog, and because, he said, "I feel like a dog sometimes too." I live for that feeling. The feeling of knowing that I have personally connected with someone, and perhaps had a small impact on their lives.

About the Program, and why it Important to Me

Birmingham City University offers a one-of-a-kind accelerated one-year MA Program concentrating on the British tradition in acting. It is designed to give International students with a foundation in Realism, and a passion for live performance the opportunity to explore just what it is that makes British acting unique. I have always idolized great British actors such as Sir Ian McKellen, Sir Anthony Hopkins, and Richard Burton. The clarity and precision these actor’s put into every scene, phrase, and word brought the world of their characters to life for me in a way that I longed to do myself. Each of these actors honed their acting skills with a foundation in the British tradition with Shakespearean, Jacobean, and Restoration texts. BCU will give me a chance to hone my skills in a similarly rigorous manner.

My Goal is to work on London's West End. I believe that with my foundation in American acting, and my training at BCU, I will take London by storm!

How You Can Help

This is a tremendous opportunity for me, but getting to Birmingham for school next month is a logistical and financial challenge. In order to make this work, I will need, among other things, plane tickets, housing deposits, and a student visa and I will need to pay for them all up front very soon.

I need your help to raise $2,200 to cover these initial costs, and 100% of every penny I receive will go to my school related expenses. It's a large amount, but every little bit will help, and hopefully I will be able to find people like you who can help me achieve this once impossible dream.

If you are not in a position to help financially, which in these tough economic times is completely understandable, you can still help by spreading the word about my campaign. Post it on social media: Facebook, Twitter, Instagram,smoke signals, messages in bottles, smoke signals, prayer, etc.

Maybe one day, another young kid in the middle of nowhere will see me bring a story to life, and realize that they too have the potential to achieve the impossible.

story:
Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

Short Summary

I am Samson Abukari, a 39 year old Community Development Practitioner residing in Tamale in the Northern Region of Ghana. I am the CEO of Watch What You Eat Foundation as organization that focuses on organic production of vegetables and the training of individuals and groups to change the mentality about poverty.

Born and bred in a rural environment, I am always reminded of the experiences that I went through growing up. As a result of this, I always have the passion to do whatever I can within my means to assist people in similar conditions so that life can be better for them as compared to what I experienced.

There are countless numbers of children in the rural areas who either go to school on empty stomach or have had food which add little or no nutrients to their bodies. This is what this campaign seeks to address and offer children some guaranteed good health and improved lives.

Your contribution to this campaign will help reduced malnutrition for about 1000 children and increase their ability to resist diseases that are common to children who are malnourished. It will also increase their desire for school and improve their concentration level during school lessons. Parents of the 1000 children will also benefit from lessons on organic production of vegetables.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is seeking for an amount of $2,500 for the purchase of seeds, garden kits, transportation of vegetables to the beneficiary schools every school day and the training of parents of the children on organic production of vegetables.

Contributors to this campaign will receive perks ranging from beautiful photos of kids from the beneficiary schools, photos of lunch time for kids of the beneficiary schools, to 5 minutes video of the implementation process of the campaign.

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign will make a great difference in the lives of about 1000 children who may be potential inventors, innovators and great problem solvers for our world. You will also be helping in the reduction of infant mortality in developing nations and above all be assisting in the enhancement of the health of a section of the children in our world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with your friends about this campaign which has the potential of touching the lives of about 1000 children. Be reminded to use your Indiegogo share tools and other media platforms to spread the news about this campaign.

story:
We Have a Question:

What Does A Computer Mean To You? 

For most of us, a computer connects us to friends or colleagues, helps us get work done, or distracts us from the work we should be doing.  When linked to great educational programming and put into the hands of a low-income student, a computer can be the tool that breaks the cycle of poverty.

You can help.

We need to buy 20 Chromebooks for the

Brighter Futures Mentoring Program for Homeless and At-Risk Youth.

 

You May Have Some Questions of Your Own:

What The Heck is a Chromebook?

So glad you asked! A Chromebook is a computer, without a hard drive, which uses Google Chrome as its operating system. This makes it a cheap alternative to a laptop with more longevity than the average netbook.  How great is that?

 

Why Do You Need Them?
Brighter Futures has partnered with Budmath, an interactive web based tutoring program to provide tutoring for homeless, low-income and at-risk students.  This software offers white board lessons and test questions for the students as well as checking the answers as they go.  Students can work at their own paces and tutors can work one-on-one with struggling students, increasing the effectiveness and impact of our tutoring sessions. Right now, the students are able to use Budmath only during the school day, if they have free time.  We want every one of our students to have access to the program.

The students who participate in Brighter Futures are the most at-risk students in Westchester's lowest performing schools.  Participants in the program are primarily homeless, low-income or foster children from Yonkers and Mt. Vernon, NY.  In one of the richest counties in the country, the graduation rate at the school most of our students attend is just 56.1%.  Brighter Futures seeks to improve the odds for children struggling with poverty in failing schools by increasing their grades and test scores, getting them involved with caring adults, and preparing them for success.

 

What’s the Big Deal?
Giving the kids in Brighter Futures the tools to succeed will help us break the cycle of poverty for those kids and their families. Our programs have already made a significant difference in the lives of our participants; improving grades, increasing graduation rates, improving test scores and getting kids who never dreamed of a post-secondary education into college.  Providing them with this tool will amplify our impacts and increase their chances at lifelong success. 

The Chromebooks will essentially level the playing field for underprivileged students, giving them effective and individualized tutoring that they otherwise could never afford.  The software focuses on preparing for the Regents Exams, New York’s standardized test to graduate high school, but the lessons also improve classroom performance and college entrance exams scores.

What Can I Do?
First: Donate, a lot or a little to help us reach our goal of $6500 (enough to purchase 20 Chromebooks)

Next: Brag about your generosity; tell your friends; share on Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Reddit, etc.

AAAAAnd Finally: Sit back and feel good about making a difference in the lives of at-risk kids.

 

Who Are You?
We’re Grace Church Community Center, Inc. (GCCC) a non-sectarian 501(c)(3) social services organization that assists Westchester County New York’s  neediest and most at-risk residents, particularly those who are under-served by existing resources. We have been fulfilling this mission since 1979.

For more info or to help in other ways, please visit our website www.gracecommunitycenter.org

 

Thanks for stopping by. We hope you can help and ask that you share this with your friends and social circle, even if you can't make a gift at this time.

story:
Short Summary

El Coloquio Anual Iberoamericano de Literatura, Política y Arte is an event organized by the Spanish Graduate Program of San Francisco State University. This is the second year this event will take place gathering people from all over United States. El Coloquio will take place on Saturday, March 22nd, 2014.

The purpose of El Coloquio is to have a set of panelist who will present their ideas and research regarding literature, politics and art, helping expand the attendees knowledge on specific issues.

This year the special guest for the event is the well-known writer Mario Bellatin. All the contributions you make will help us cover El Coloquio's expenses. Mario Bellatin has already accepted to come from Mexico to San Francisco, so we will have him, as well as other panelists, share some of their knowledge with us.

Help us create a close community of people interested in Literature, Politics and Art.

What We Need:

We need you help to us raise funds to pay for the following expenses:

  • We need about $800 to pay for our special guest's flight and hotel in San Francisco for the weekend of March 20th - March 23rd. - It's has been bought already, so we have to reimburse the purchase.
  • We need food to feed all the participants, who will be at SFSU all day long. The event takes place from 10am to 6pm approximately.
  • We need materials to provide the participants, such as pencils, paper, etc
  • We need funds to print the pamphlets with the event's program and key information for participants to move around campus.

Our goal is $1500 for now, but we need a lot more contributions. If you cannot donate money, please pass along the word and help us get food or supplies for the event. Any help is welcome!

The Impact:

By contributing to this event, you will be helping out the small community of SFSU connect with larger groups from all over United States. We are expecting participants from all over CA and even people flying from the East Coast. It is our goal to create a close group of people interested in the arts, who can get together to chat and challenge each other to learn more.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you cannot help us with money, please help in other ways:

  • Please re-post this in any social media platform that you use, such as Facebook, Twitter, etc. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Contact us if you want to contribute with food and supplies.
  • email us to: coloquiosfsu@gmail.com

Thank you!
story_txt:
Short SummaryEl Coloquio Anual Iberoamericano de Literatura, Política y Arte is an event organized by the Spanish Graduate Program of San Francisco State University. This is the second year this event will take place gathering people from all over United States. El Coloquio will take place on Saturday, March 22nd, 2014.The purpose of El Coloquio is to have a set of panelist who will present their ideas and research regarding literature, politics and art, helping expand the attendees knowledge on specific issues. This year the special guest for the event is the well-known writer Mario Bellatin. All the contributions you make will help us cover El Coloquio's expenses. Mario Bellatin has already accepted to come from Mexico to San Francisco, so we will have him, as well as other panelists, share some of their knowledge with us.Help us create a close community of people interested in Literature, Politics and Art. What We Need:We need you help to us raise funds to pay for the following expenses:
We need about $800 to pay for our special guest's flight and hotel in San Francisco for the weekend of March 20th - March 23rd. - It's has been bought already, so we have to reimburse the purchase. 

We need food to feed all the participants, who will be at SFSU all day long. The event takes place from 10am to 6pm approximately.

We need materials to provide the participants, such as pencils, paper, etc
We need funds to print the pamphlets with the event's program and key information for participants to move around campus. 

Our goal is $1500 for now, but we need a lot more contributions. If you cannot donate money, please pass along the word and help us get food or supplies for the event. Any help is welcome!The Impact:By contributing to this event, you will be helping out the small community of SFSU connect with larger groups from all over United States. We are expecting participants from all over CA and even people flying from the East Coast. It is our goal to create a close group of people interested in the arts, who can get together to chat and challenge each other to learn more. Other Ways You Can Help:If you cannot help us with money, please help in other ways:
Please re-post this in any social media platform that you use, such as Facebook, Twitter, etc. You can use the Indiegogo share tools.

Contact us if you want to contribute with food and supplies. 

email us to: coloquiosfsu@gmail.com

Thank you!

story:
Hi! My name is Ivan. I’m a student, a published poet and an occasional performer.  I come from Croatia in Europe. Recently, I’ve finished my Gender Studies degree where I have learned lots of interesting things about gender, sexuality, and performance. Additionally, I’ve also encountered that performance is not something that is necessarily situated in the theater or street, but that we also perform variety of roles in everyday life – like for example, we perform gender, class and some other things.

 

Since I have particular interests in practical performance, its political and social effects, and how the practice interacts with scholarly theory, I’ve decided to apply to a program in Performance Studies at Tisch School of the Arts in New York. When the admissions results came, I was positively shocked. I was even more shocked after I encountered that I received a generous tuition award that covers most of my tuition expenses. However, after researching what does it mean to be a student in New York I found myself in a quite negative shock.

 

I managed to collect some further funds from my friends and family, but still I need some additional financial help for expenses like books, food and other living expenses. If you’re able, would you please help in de-shocking me? Are you a kind helper?   

 

In my future project, I will be dealing with theory on queer subjectivities in correlation with the case study of Antony Hegarty. Did you hear about Antony? I got incredibly touched by Antony’s music and performances, and I perceive her work as poetry that has broader political and social implications. In my opinion, performance can have powerful effects, especially if its results are affects such as excitement, shame, anticipation, and fear.

 

As your help can have healing effects in de-shocking me, Antony’s music and performances can also have healing effects for her targeted audience of a wider transgender and queer community. Please de-shock me with your kindness! Please help me if you’re able to. Send me in New York. In return, I have prepared some interesting perks for you!

Thank you!

 

***

Many thanks to my friends Nika, Viktor and Luka for helping me with the video (I have such kind friends)! xxo

_________________________
You can also find me at https://www.facebook.com/DeShockingIvan

_________________________
Check out the funny moments from filming the De-shocking video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U--_ARoMKaA&feature=youtu.be

story:
Who Am I?

Hi, my name is Ayla Sullivan and I am am striving to be the best artist I can be.  I am sixteen years old and my dream is to help my community by supporting the pursuit of art programs in schools through furthering my education in a college level program.

This is a big task to take on, especially for a sixteen year old who already has responsibilites as being an officer on her school's theatre honor society and Improv Club board, a student that is a part of the International Bacculearate program, and an upcoming member of the National Honor Society next year. But, I am up to the challenge. 

In the past, I have lead a dance workshop for middle school aged children and was a part of a panel to help coach children's acting monologues at last year's Denver School of the Arts Middle School Theatre Convention. I am a firm believer that theatre has the ability to save people from all backgrounds, all social statuses, and all ages. 

So why in my introduction video of this campaign did I say that theatre can help teach others the "essence of humanity"? Honestly, how can theatre and the performing arts really teach that? 

Theatre is more than just "playing pretend". It is, as Picasso once said about the nature of art, "...a lie that reveals the truth." This manufactured fabrication offered on stages and film media across the globe allows audiences to be captivated by one single idea from a range of thirty minutes to two hours that aims to change their life and perspective. Beyond that, theatre offers a reflection of personalities, real life situations, and true struggles that all humans face at some point in their lives. Exposing children to this art form allows them the ability to not only be entertained, but also gives them an outlet that displays realities of the world that they can be immersed in, whether it be as an audience member or as a member of the ensemble. 

Positive expression is easily one of the most important tools needed in every child's (and every human being's) arsenal. The performing arts give students a  healthy medium to explore their wants, needs, dreams, and deepest emotions in a safe and encouraging environment. In a time where education cuts are being made in a multitude of areas in the school system here in the United States, it is imperative to support this necessary component in child development. 

Okay, but how does this tie into attending a performing arts program?

My goal is to continue to be a working advocate for the arts in my community by volunteering for various arts related activites in elementary and middle schools, as well as working toward creating a Middle School Convention just for students in the Cherry Creek School District. By gaining more leadership experience in this field, I can better myself and ultimately get to a successful level of becoming a performing arts teacher after I get my college education. 

It is through this goal that I understand that the biggest factor in accomplishing my dreams is getting the best possible education for myself in the performing arts. 

Perry Mansfield Performing Arts School and Camp has been a running institution for the past century. It has nurtured students to their greatest potential as artists in varying fields, and I am honored to have been accepted into their six week pre professional program. This intensive is specifically designed to ease college level students into their artistic careers. It is the perfect opportunity for me to hone on my skills as an artist, become more knowledable in the arts, and give me a competitive edge when I begin to apply to colleges in the not too distant future. Perry Mansfield is the first hurdle I must conquer in my quest for my own education to benefit the education of others. But, the program is outside my financial means, and I need your help to allow me to put my best foot forward in a country with a struggling economy and a cut throat college system. 

 

Help Three Causes for The Price of ONE

The tuition for this program is $5,000 dollars and if I raise half of the funds, Perry Mansfield will graciously pay for the other half. 

Any amount of money helps and I am grateful to anyone who can take the time to help donate to my cause. The perks attached to this campaign cover an array of interesting, personalized gifts which include letters, art, mix cd's, my own recordings, and other ways I can show you how appreciative I am to you through my art. 

In addition to funding my dream, all proceeds that exceed my goal will be split in half and donated to two other causes: First I will donate to an Oklahoma Relief Non Profit Organization and secondly, I will establish a scholarship for another potential student at Perry Mansfield.

It is important to note that whatever funds I can donate to Oklahoma Relief will be matched by my mother's employers to give the victims and families of the Oklahoma disaster double the relief. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I am definitely aware that there are people who would love to donate to my campaign, but just can't contribute right now. The best way to help is through any additional advertising for my campaign, whether that be through word of mouth or various social media websites. Every dollar counts! 

To support that idea, anyone who can signal boost my campaign on three or more websites or posts about my campaign on a single website three or more times: I will name you as a contributor in the video and/or blog site I will make to sum up what I have learned from Perry Mansfield's program after I (hopefully) attend. 

 

Thank you so much for reading about my campaign and being interested in funding my dream!

For any additional information or questions please contact me at aylaxc.sullivan@gmail.com

story:
What if instead of discovering the polio vaccine, Jonas Salk had contracted the disease and couldn’t afford to stay in college.  Don’t let illness take away a college education.

Help The Orion Fund change one life and perhaps you will change the
world!

A $5,000 Grant Safety Net for a Student in Medical Crisis

The Orion Fund provides grants for college students in medical crisis.  We cover medical, educational and living expenses for students caught in difficult circumstances.  Our students have cancer, traumatic brain injury, Crohn's disease, multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis, emergency open heart surgery, car crashes...  the list goes on. Every little bit helps these students - they are often just getting by, with rising college and living costs, and often with families unable to help - and that's before they get sick or injured. 

We are here to raise $5,000 to support a student like Paula for a year.

Paula was diagnosed with Ewings Sarcoma (cancer) her junior year at U.C. Berkeley.  She was first in her family to go to college and she was supporting herself with two jobs when she became ill.  She needed full support - rent, food, medical expenses, and college costs for the classes she could still attend, working often from her hospital bed.  Chemo (and all the side effects) lasted most of her junior year, and we were so happy to be able to help her.     

Paula's story:

A little bit about The Orion Fund

Our website: TOF Website Link has lots of information about The Orion Fund - including our grant application!  (just in case you're a student in need)

We are a board of 8 volunteers, and we have been awarding grants for the past ten years.  Students from over 25 college campuses in California send us applications every year - we have funded about 78 grant requests since we started. 

But we are unable to fund all the students that apply - we simply run out of dollars each year.  So we spread our resources among many students but we also know that there are those students that truly need longer term support.  This $5,000 grant is for that student, without affecting our annual grants.  So we've turned to Indiegogo - come be part of The Orion Fund!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Leaphia Darko and I am a 23yr old actress from Plumstead in South East London who is passionate about theatre and desperate to better herself.

 

  • I have recently been informed that I have been awarded a place on the BA in Acting course at RADA for September 2013
  • This year over 3,300 people auditioned for the 27 places on offer over a period of 10 months and through 4 rounds of auditions so I am both amazed and exited at having been offered a place.
  • I am changing career path as I already have a degree (English and Classics 2:1) so don't qualify for any Student Loans Company funding

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

I need to raise £3000 to be able to register for my first term September 2013 as tuition fees are now £9000 per year. (the extra £250 will leave me with enough to pay the fees after Indiegogo have taken their commission)

 

  • To say thank you everyone will recieve an e-card from me and higher tier contributors will recieve personal updates of my theatrical progress and my services as a public speaking coach!

     

  • I am literally scraping the fees together so every penny helps! Whatever I manage to raise will be put towards my fees anyway

    The Impact

  • Training at RADA is a dream come true. It is an elite institution which has trained many of my favourite actors from Vivien Leigh to Ralph Fiennes.

 

  • This has been the culmination of 7 years of work for me. I auditioned in 2011 and didn't pass the first round. I went away and worked hard. I took unpaid roles in shows with the Roundhouse, The National Youth Theatre, The  Royal Shakespeare Company, The Old Vic New Voices community group and the Olympic and Paralympic Ceremonies to gain experience. This year all of this hard work paid off.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Thank you for taking the time to read this page even if you can't donate youself! There are still ways in which you can assist me...

     

  • Please help me spread the word about my campaign. The target may seem big but just a few quid from people would add up!

 

  • Don't forget you can use the Indiegogo share tools to tweet, facebook and email the link for this campaign to the rest of the world!
 
Thank you for your time guys  :)

story:
Hi there and welcome to my school, a unique concept in that I cater for pre-school children and adults from the rural community in the valley surrounding my farm!

First off, let me introduce myself. My name is Alison Botha, Ali for short. I have a number of passions in life but those that have always ranked top of my list are the care and rescue of animals and to help persons less fortunate. This is why, almost 20 years ago, I decided to give up my job as a career-driven TV producer/editor, and contribute to those in need. To this end, I am home to numerous rescue animals on my farm in Mpumalanga, and have recently found myself single-handedly running a rural school! So far these efforts have been self-funded.

We were recently very fortunate to have been donated a classroom – a converted 12m container. Unfortunately we have no electricity or water on site and all funding at this stage will go towards these basic needs as well as much needed ablution facilities.

Please visit my website www.lydenrust.com for the full heartbreaking story on why I started this project.

"Like" our Faceook page https://www.facebook.com/LydenrustRuralFarmSchool for daily updates and lots of wonderful pictures.

Thank you for taking the time to read this, much love Ali & the Lydenrust children

story:
Together, We Can Make a Difference

The Problem: Severe Kenyan Teacher Shortage

There is a shortage of 70,000 teachers in Kenya. Growing up in Kenya, most people I knew were forced to learn in classrooms with over 42 kids for 1 teacher.

What does this mean?

As a teacher, it means you are wondering how that single Math assignment you gave suddenly morphed into 42 different scripts that are waiting for you to grade.  You feel overwhelmed as all the Creative Writing compositions beg for your attention- and so do your students. You realize you can’t do it all- and you probably feel guilty.

As a student in this large class, you are wondering when the teacher will finally speak with you. Does she even know your name? Your exercise book has not been touched by her in a while- does she even care? You feel you are getting lost, gradually- but no one is there to notice. You’re struggling- but there’s no one there to help. When asked about it, this is what you have to say:

“We were so congested…. you could not have time to ask questions…. There were few materials. Desks were few and some were forced to sit on the floor. The teacher could not…. mark our books and so one could not know where he or she had gone wrong…. (Girl, 14)”


The Opportunity: Mobilizing Kenyan Young Leaders

There is an opportunity for young people to be a part of the solution. In Kenya, high school graduates have to wait 9 months after their national examinations before entering university. This window, the 9-month pre-university gap, is a period for them to create, innovate and impact the country’s future immensely. This window is an opportunity for them to help bridge the glaring gap of teaching and learning resources in the country! 


The Solution:  PACE
Promoting Access to Community Education (PACE) International is the first educational volunteering program that re-injects the skills and abilities of Kenyan youth into the school system. Under PACE, the youth work as teaching assistants to help in grading, tutoring and mentoring in schools in rural and slum areas in Kenya. In exchange, the volunteers would be rewarded with job-readiness training as well entrepreneurship and financial skills development.

Our History: Reaching 3500 students in our 1st year

Peggy Mativo conceptualized PACE in April 2012.  She took a year off from Harvard as an undergrad to follow this dream. Joining the rest of the PACE team in Kenya- they worked hard to get PACE off the ground. This is what they’ve accomplished:

- Recruited, trained and sent out 80 volunteers

- Reached 3500 students in 6 different schools 

-  More than 5500 hours of community service from the TAs alone-

  Set-up reading clubs, library re-organizations and field hockey clubs in two schools

Our volunteers who go above and beyond to serve have inspired us. They are the ones getting to school at 6.30 a.m. to prepare before students arrive, tutoring kids for free on Saturday mornings, sacrificing part of their lunch breaks to run reading clubs and walking for an hour each way so they can teach French in a school in the heart of Kibera.

We can do so much more- but we need your help. Our 2014 goal is to send out 300 trained volunteers who will help at least 13500 students in underserved schools.

Our Request:  Help Us Raise $10,000

$10,000, our first milestone, will send 60 volunteers and 2 full-time staff members to avail 9000+ hours of community service to support the kids who go to schools in rural and slum areas in Kenya. 

The money raised will cover transportation and a modest meal for the volunteers. Any money we receive above our $10000 goal will be used to send more volunteers to schools in need.

How else can you help? 

We appreciate all your help: please join our team and spread the word. Tell your colleagues; your friends and your family- invite them to this page.  Share on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and all your social media favorites. 
Thank you.
story_txt:
Together, We Can Make a Difference
The Problem: Severe Kenyan Teacher Shortage
There is a shortage of 70,000 teachers in Kenya. Growing
up in Kenya, most people I knew were forced to learn in classrooms with over 42
kids for 1 teacher. 
What does this mean? 
As a teacher, it means you are wondering how that single
Math assignment you gave suddenly morphed into 42 different scripts that are
waiting for you to grade.  You feel
overwhelmed as all the Creative Writing compositions beg for your attention- and
so do your students. You realize you can’t do it all- and you probably feel
guilty.
As a student in this large class, you are wondering when the teacher will
finally speak with you. Does she even know your name? Your exercise book has
not been touched by her in a while- does she even care? You feel you are
getting lost, gradually- but no one is there to notice. You’re struggling- but
there’s no one there to help. When asked about it, this is what you have to
say: 
“We were so congested…. you could not have time to ask questions…. There were
few materials. Desks were few and some were forced to sit on the floor. The
teacher could not…. mark our books and so one could not know where he or she
had gone wrong…. (Girl, 14)”

The Opportunity: Mobilizing Kenyan
Young Leaders
There is an opportunity for young
people to be a part of the solution. In Kenya, high school
graduates have to wait 9 months after their national examinations before
entering university. This window, the 9-month pre-university gap, is a
period for them to create, innovate and impact the country’s future immensely.
This window is an opportunity for them to help bridge the glaring gap of
teaching and learning resources in the country! 
The Solution: 
PACE
Promoting Access to Community Education (PACE) International is the first
educational volunteering program that re-injects the skills and abilities
of Kenyan youth into the school system. Under PACE, the youth work as
teaching assistants to help in grading, tutoring and mentoring in
schools in rural and slum areas in Kenya. In exchange, the volunteers would be
rewarded with job-readiness training as well entrepreneurship and financial
skills development.

Our History: Reaching 3500 students in our 1st year
Peggy Mativo conceptualized PACE in April 2012.  She took a year off from Harvard as an
undergrad to follow this dream. Joining the rest of the PACE team in Kenya-
they worked hard to get PACE off the ground. This is what they’ve accomplished:

- Recruited, trained and sent out 80 volunteers
- Reached 3500 students in 6
different schools 
-  More than 5500 hours of community service
from the TAs alone-  Set-up reading clubs, library re-organizations
and field hockey clubs in two schools
Our volunteers who go above and beyond to serve have
inspired us. They are the ones getting to school at 6.30 a.m. to prepare before
students arrive, tutoring kids for free on Saturday mornings, sacrificing part
of their lunch breaks to run reading clubs and walking for an hour each way so
they can teach French in a school in the heart of Kibera. 
We can do so much more- but we
need your help. Our 2014 goal is to send out 300 trained volunteers who
will help at least 13500 students in underserved schools.
Our Request:  Help Us Raise $10,000
$10,000, our first
milestone, will send 60 volunteers and 2
full-time staff members to avail 9000+ hours of community
service to support the kids who go to schools in rural and slum areas
in Kenya. 
The money raised will cover transportation and a modest meal
for the volunteers. Any money we receive above our $10000 goal will be used to
send more volunteers to schools in need.
How else can you help? 
We appreciate all your help: please join our team and spread the word. Tell
your colleagues; your friends and your family- invite them to this page.  Share on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and
all your social media favorites. 
Thank you.

story:
My name is Claude (a picture here with my sister) and I am here bacause I am going to Sweden to do my masters and would like to raise money to help me out with my studies. Your contribution will help to achieve that. I have saved money and I am getting some student loans but it is not enough. School fees and living expenses will be about 30,000$ so that 1,500 will get me a plane ticket back home when i am done! :) 

Let's put it this way, i gather that most of you will be people I know, so if i don't have time to sit down with all of you to have a glass of wine or two to say goodbye before i leave, just put that money here and save us a hangover!  Seriously though, since my masters will be in  Strategic Leadership towards Sustainability (I am one of 50 people chosen from around the world to do this program), my goal is to work for water conservation, ecosystem restoration and consultation for business of all sizes to help make the triple bottom line (people-planet-profit) the best way to do business. 

Thank you for reading and helping me!

story:
We need to hire a Lawyer!!!!!     That handsome little devil that is smiling so beautifully above is my son Jr & my dear Keara before this all happened. I would say "I am taking your picture" and he was ready and waiting with a smile ready to go! But as you will see that little light isn't there and it hasn't been since his mother turned his and his sisters lives upside down! But, with the help I am hoping to get , I just know I/we can get that Beaming Smile back on his and his sisters faces! FYI The sad ones are of them now!  & you can Donate as little as $1 Every bit helps! Thanks! Anyone that would like to send well wishes can send to us at  *1863 W 3rd St. Mesa, Az. 85201*  Words of hope are Welcomed!!!

 The same goes for this little Beauty above, she is my Awesome little Keara!

And she has them around a VERIFIED CHILD MOLESTER. Who she has been seeing since I got sick. Something is wrong in her head, she was raped and beat by this same guy when she was 15 and he was 22! And now she has him around my children!! So right before her 18th birthday I met her and I just turned 18 we had our first daughter when we were 19.  So I said to heck with it and moved my new family 2 towns away! And after 18 years together, 3 children and me working 12-16 hour days for 15 years at the same job same company so she could be a stay at home mom which I believed was best for the kids, you know a nice stable life not to mention I thought it was the normal thing to do! Well boom I get hit by the perfect storm as far as bad things happening, I do the whole hospital then bed thing, while I am on meds in bed unable to move for the majority of the time she moved her mom and brother in, I would go for a day or two at a time without eating (she was my loving caregiver) meanwhile shes slowly taking all of our most valuable things and hiding them while I am passed out. Over about 7 months I lost 40 lbs. When she was in the room she would just cut me down verbally in everyway possible!  I didn't care if I was better, I stopped taking the meds that kept me lifeless & I tried going back to work. Well 2 months of me struggling back at work she kidnapped our kids!

The worst 7 days of my life!!! And I spent every waking minute searching for them, And by the grace of God I found them on that 7th day! And yes it was like the best day of my life emotionally it seemed, and when I found them they came running to me arms open jumping into my arms then jumped into my car, saying please don't let her take us again! They told me how she would leave with people they didn't know, made them stay in a back room of some house with threats of the belt if they peeked out!  Well from then to now has been a whole new Nightmare that seems will never end!

The judge is treating her as if she has done nothing and has forced me to let her keep them around her and the child molester which of course she lied under oath on the stand to the judge saying she has no boyfriend its just her and the kids! Meanwhile I am telling him to let the kids talk and they will fold every lie she tells which are many! At least 5 lies under oath and the judge even caught her in at least 3 of them and acts as if its nothing! He DOES NOTHING! Now I am back under Dr care I have lost my job I am having break through seizures. After the last hearing I have found actual picture proof of her  associating with Multiple Meth cooks, Meth sellers and Meth addicts. She has these scums around my kids on her 50% of parenting time she leaves them at peoples houses they don't even know! Lets see your dating a child molester and leaving the kids alone with him and with Meth Addicts, but I am supposed to trust they are safe? And this is not even half of the nightmare, but asking for help does not come easy to me, I have always been the one that did the helping. But if I don't get some major help and quick I am going to lose my kids to her and I can not even bare the thought of that! I have spent most of my savings on my lawyer, who threatens to drop my case if I talk to her about how I feel concerning the case, even though I have already paid her! Since the day I could work I did and I always took care of mine and others in need, so just like asking for help doesn't come easy letting not to mention 1 person on the outside know about my troubles but however many read this page is just something I don't do, But for my kids I will do whatever it takes and right now this is my only option. Any donater that wants the whole story I am willing to tell it all in exchange for your generosity! And I would just like to Thank you for reading my troubles and Thank anyone that helps us in advance, So Thank You this means more then I can put into words!     

Short Summary

   So as I said I have worked most of my life, now that I am considered "Disabled" I cant even get unemployment! Which was paid to the "system" for me during my work career, but that doesn't seem to mean anything to them! But since I am in that condition I have ran out of all my savings and all I have left is my vehicle. How I will pay my rent and the rest that comes with a house and my kids eating and getting them back and forth to school and on my picking them up and dropping them off for parent exchange are things that I have to do or I will lose them to her! I have limited myself to eating once a day to save food for them.

 Getting help here is all I have to give me hope that there lives are not ruined by child molesters and drug dealers and addicts that have become common place in the mothers life!  Now the Magnitude of this is beyond my control without help. So with help I will have the chance of still winning my childrens well being and a future for them that does not become some statistic read about in the paper! It is a FACT that the people she is friends with have lost children to death and cps yet she allows them around our kids and leaves them alone with them! But its obvious they are not her main concern, her party life is all she is concerned with! So again with help I can ensure there safety!!! To be with someone for 18 years that turns a 180 degrees on you when you need them the most is bad enough, but to also have to watch her also try and destroy my childrens lives/future is a whole new heartbreak all together!

What We Need & What You Get

.WE NEED a Real Lawyer!!! Well I am hoping I would either 1 be back well enough to work or 2 be getting the disability money back that I paid into the system toward the end of next year!     Every donation no matter how small or large is a tremendous help!   And if you cant help financially I understand, we are not the only ones in bad shape. But if you can just spread the word to everyone you know it is just as valuable!! Just sharing our profile link on G+ or Facebook and Twitter or just plain good old fashion e-mail would be help in and of itself!! And you truly have no idea how much I appreciate both kinds of help! And just as kind of an fyi, I need money now, but at least if I see that people are helping then I could do a title loan on my truck, knowing that I could repay it! But as things are now if I did a loan on it I would have no way to pay it back. Then it would be taken and I would be in an even worse spot with no way to get my children, no way to court and all around stranded! At least if I lost my house I could sleep in my truck, Please!!! Any help at all would be ever so helpful and we give our Thanks and gratitude!!!! Thank you!

The Impact

 

   I know I am not the only one that understands what a good and healthy childhood means to someone as they then become adults. So the Impact and the difference your help can make would speak volumes in the long run! And I truly believe that my children, in the right environment can grow into some really special individuals! And right now they are at a very impressionable and important age in there lives! Anything bad right now can scar them for life which I could not bare! So to receive help to insure that does not happen would mean more to us then I could ever put into words alone!  Now I have made I think some progress with the judge, but as I said my lawyer has threatened to drop me if I talk about how I feel! Unfortunately that firm was the only one I could afford! But I guarantee if this campaign goes better then I could hope it does, and if I get enough help I will be able to tell my lawyer to do just what she wants and I could hire a real Attorney! And oh let me tell you, that may be the best thing I could possibly get! Even broke I still would not have them around a child molester and druggies!!! Which is where there mother keeps demanding they be. But I have only scraped the top of things as far as what I have told you because I just don't have the room to tell it all here. But as a PERK for your donation I will tell the whole story! I believe if someone is willing to help me then they should be given all the info they want! So once again you truly have no idea how much this will be appreciated and remembered!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • And sharing our profile link on G+, Facebook, Twiiter and good old fashion e-mail is again help that counts!
  • And last but not least Thank You so much from the bottom, top and sides of our hearts!!!!!!!

story:
The Product.  Clipp allows you to configure data the way your mind thinks -- in images. A central projectline reinforces the coveted one-on-one method no matter how many students. Our cohesive product design efficiently organizes everything in one place for ease of use. Any curriculum flows naturally. Students can now concentrate more on listening and participating in the class discussion, knowing they can review any written notes, video, or audio uploaded to the projectline, during or after class.  Real-time reporting gives immediate feedback of lesson understanding. Whatever the preferred curricular method, customization is in the hands of the creator, be it student or teacher.  The flipped classroom, flipped back again.

Clipp STORES AND ORGANIZES everything about the classroom all in one convenient, digital place.


Specifically, here's why we’re excited:

Key Features.
 
1. Projectline:  

The projectline is literally a grid that is scrollable in any direction, searchable and sortable. It allows teachers to load all necessary files into the grid to teach a class from their iPad. This can be loaded whenever: before the semester begins, during a class or afterwards, allowing for customization. Curricula can even be imported from a third-party creator.  Students with access can load homework assignments, class projects, or access files the teacher loaded. Students can pull files up to review them on their iPad. Files such as movies can be accessed and played as part of the class. Even a live lecture can be recorded during class from the iPad and then stored in the projectline for later playback. The teacher may use a pre-recorded lecture to play in class or students can access that later for review. Since the screens between student and teacher can be interactive, an infinite exchange of information is capable. Clipp truly is the digital hub to the classroom.

2. Data Your Way:  There’s tons of material in any curriculum that needs to be organized and quantified.  Clipp has a reporting function that allows students and teachers with access to cull any information, in any file.  This can be added to the projectline into a polished and organized summary. This saves huge amounts of time, creating the most effective and detailed study guides. All this, with just a few taps of the screen. Additionally, Clipp performs grading upon completion of tests, generates lesson plans and administrative reviews.  Live polling and real time surveys enable greater teacher adaptability to a particular class understanding level. Students can now enjoy running their own study groups, managing class projects, and even uploading their homework to the projectline.

3. Use with Favorites:  Clipp is designed to work in conjunction with all your favorite third party apps.  Whether exchanging information, creating or transferring files, or just communicating, Clipp brings all your favorite apps together in one place to help you achieve the ultimate in knowledge transfer.

All of this helps students and teachers understand learning objectives right where praise or correction is still fresh and meaningful. That's why we say, Clipp is everything a student and teacher does, all at one connection point.  

With Clipp you can also CREATE from stored information. This includes instant study guides, lesson plans, grading, etc.

The iPad. The bet is about students using more than 10 percent of their brains’ capacity, not on technology. Good technology gets out of the way.  And the iPad does just that.  Is there an elephant in the room about whether the distribution vehicle we’ve chosen is the right option?  To paraphrase a popular Wayne Gretzky quote, “We’re skating to where the puck is going, not where it’s been.”  The iPad occupies over 50% of the tablet market.  It is so dominant that the impact is being felt in PC education sales, which declined 13% in the last year.  The iPad is seeing such fast adoption rates not only because it is school-budget friendly, but more importantly, because educators are seeing results in the classroom.


What we're seeing with the iPad is that, they[students] are
engaged.  We put the iPad in front of them and you'll see the
kids immediately focus right on that content and start
working through it.  In a short amount of time, we're seeing
gains as high as 50-60% in reading, math and science with
our classes using the iPads. I really believe that this is the
future of education.

            
        -John Connolly, Technology Director of Chicago Public Schools

We couldn’t agree more. Now with Clipp, knowledge is verifiable, quantifiable, and, yes, thanks to the iPad, touchable.

Everything stored is SEARCHABLE AND SORTABLE in real-time (like Google for your classwork).

Us.  We believe in superior American education even more than the many hours we have spent developing this product.  It’s not about creating just another product. Learning is more than throwing a computer in front of a student. We know it is difficult to understand and apply new concepts. Students process things their way, on their time. We feel strongly about taking the organizational format of the message out of the way. This allows the presentation of the idea to take place front and center.  It allows a thought to be dissected, critically assimilated and expounded upon.  With the lesson in place, more time can be devoted to a student’s developing mind and students can look forward to finding new and amazing ways to tap into their own creativity, all while learning required curricula.  That’s what we’re all about.

Clipp WORKS WITH OTHER APPS, so you don’t have to choose or discard your favorites.

Tom. Having put my own children through parochial, public and homeschooling, education remains a top priority. Training co-workers and students in computer-centric programs throughout my technical career has given me the zeal to seek the ultimate in learning potential.  Creating a program is not enough. Persistent pursuit of higher ideals in education has to be the motivating focus.  Both Marty and I believe the time is now to make learning a gray-matter rich and empowering process. We know that our education system deserves to be an example to the world. We believe Clipp is primary to that pursuit.

Marty. My background includes experience working for and climbing the ladders of some very prominent corporations, including Apple, Target, and Best Buy. I learned many things while working in these competitive environments, and sharing in the successes.  Mostly, the sum of the parts is always more important than the individual. Because of that, I’ve always had a voracious thirst for being part of something bigger, something meaningful.  I’m talking about legacy. When you wake up every morning, what do you see? As Jobs once said, “Do you want to make sugar water, or do you want to change the world?” Education is important. Education is meaningful. And America has fallen significantly behind, so it’s time we rise to the occasion.

Clipp is EVERYTHING a student and teacher does, all at one connection point.

*The Offer. We believe Clipp should be used by every student and teacher.  We realize that most successful Indiegogo campaigns have given their product as the ultimate incentive. To that end, upon completion of the final version of Clipp, those schools who sign up for beta testing a pilot program will receive a download of the product, free. So let us hear back from those who would like to become part of the movement to put American education in first place. Help us bring student and teacher together in the digital age. Start the discussion at your school to propel this project onward.
story_txt:
The Product.  Clipp allows you to configure data the way your mind thinks -- in images. A central projectline reinforces the coveted one-on-one method no matter how many students. Our cohesive product design efficiently organizes everything in one place for ease of use. Any curriculum flows naturally. Students can now concentrate more on listening and participating in the class discussion, knowing they can review any written notes, video, or audio uploaded to the projectline, during or after class.  Real-time reporting gives immediate feedback of lesson understanding. Whatever the preferred curricular method, customization is in the hands of the creator, be it student or teacher.  The flipped classroom, flipped back again.
Clipp STORES AND ORGANIZES everything about the classroom all in one convenient, digital place.
Specifically, here's why we’re excited:Key Features.  1. Projectline:  

The projectline is literally a grid that is scrollable in any direction, searchable and sortable. It allows teachers to load all necessary files into the grid to teach a class from their iPad. This can be loaded whenever: before the semester begins, during a class or afterwards, allowing for customization. Curricula can even be imported from a third-party creator.  Students with access can load homework assignments, class projects, or access files the teacher loaded. Students can pull files up to review them on their iPad. Files such as movies can be accessed and played as part of the class. Even a live lecture can be recorded during class from the iPad and then stored in the projectline for later playback. The teacher may use a pre-recorded lecture to play in class or students can access that later for review. Since the screens between student and teacher can be interactive, an infinite exchange of information is capable. Clipp truly is the digital hub to the classroom.
2. Data Your Way:  There’s tons of material in any curriculum that needs to be organized and quantified.  Clipp has a reporting function that allows students and teachers with access to cull any information, in any file.  This can be added to the projectline into a polished and organized summary. This saves huge amounts of time, creating the most effective and detailed study guides. All this, with just a few taps of the screen. Additionally, Clipp performs grading upon completion of tests, generates lesson plans and administrative reviews.  Live polling and real time surveys enable greater teacher adaptability to a particular class understanding level. Students can now enjoy running their own study groups, managing class projects, and even uploading their homework to the projectline.3. Use with Favorites:  Clipp is designed to work in conjunction with all your favorite third party apps.  Whether exchanging information, creating or transferring files, or just communicating, Clipp brings all your favorite apps together in one place to help you achieve the ultimate in knowledge transfer.All of this helps students and teachers understand learning objectives right where praise or correction is still fresh and meaningful. That's why we say, Clipp is everything a student and teacher does, all at one connection point.  
With Clipp you can also CREATE from stored information. This includes instant study guides, lesson plans, grading, etc.
The iPad. The bet is about students using more than 10 percent of their brains’ capacity, not on technology. Good technology gets out of the way.  And the iPad does just that.  Is there an elephant in the room about whether the distribution vehicle we’ve chosen is the right option?  To paraphrase a popular Wayne Gretzky quote, “We’re skating to where the puck is going, not where it’s been.”  The iPad occupies over 50% of the tablet market.  It is so dominant that the impact is being felt in PC education sales, which declined 13% in the last year.  The iPad is seeing such fast adoption rates not only because it is school-budget friendly, but more importantly, because educators are seeing results in the classroom.
What we're seeing with the iPad is that, they[students] areengaged.  We put the iPad in front of them and you'll see the kids immediately focus right on that content and start working through it.  In a short amount of time, we're seeing gains as high as 50-60% in reading, math and science with our classes using the iPads. I really believe that this is the future of education.
                    -John Connolly, Technology Director of Chicago Public SchoolsWe couldn’t agree more. Now with Clipp, knowledge is verifiable, quantifiable, and, yes, thanks to the iPad, touchable.
Everything stored is SEARCHABLE AND SORTABLE in real-time (like Google for your classwork).
Us.  We believe in superior American education even more than the many hours we have spent developing this product.  It’s not about creating just another product. Learning is more than throwing a computer in front of a student. We know it is difficult to understand and apply new concepts. Students process things their way, on their time. We feel strongly about taking the organizational format of the message out of the way. This allows the presentation of the idea to take place front and center.  It allows a thought to be dissected, critically assimilated and expounded upon.  With the lesson in place, more time can be devoted to a student’s developing mind and students can look forward to finding new and amazing ways to tap into their own creativity, all while learning required curricula.  That’s what we’re all about.
Clipp WORKS WITH OTHER APPS, so you don’t have to choose or discard your favorites.
Tom. Having put my own children through parochial, public and homeschooling, education remains a top priority. Training co-workers and students in computer-centric programs throughout my technical career has given me the zeal to seek the ultimate in learning potential.  Creating a program is not enough. Persistent pursuit of higher ideals in education has to be the motivating focus.  Both Marty and I believe the time is now to make learning a gray-matter rich and empowering process. We know that our education system deserves to be an example to the world. We believe Clipp is primary to that pursuit.Marty. My background includes experience working for and climbing the ladders of some very prominent corporations, including Apple, Target, and Best Buy. I learned many things while working in these competitive environments, and sharing in the successes.  Mostly, the sum of the parts is always more important than the individual. Because of that, I’ve always had a voracious thirst for being part of something bigger, something meaningful.  I’m talking about legacy. When you wake up every morning, what do you see? As Jobs once said, “Do you want to make sugar water, or do you want to change the world?” Education is important. Education is meaningful. And America has fallen significantly behind, so it’s time we rise to the occasion.
Clipp is EVERYTHING a student and teacher does, all at one connection point.
*The Offer. We believe Clipp should be used by every student and teacher.  We realize that most successful Indiegogo campaigns have given their product as the ultimate incentive. To that end, upon completion of the final version of Clipp, those schools who sign up for beta testing a pilot program will receive a download of the product, free. So let us hear back from those who would like to become part of the movement to put American education in first place. Help us bring student and teacher together in the digital age. Start the discussion at your school to propel this project onward.

story:
Let's Win This Anyways

We won't take no from the universe. We're still going to raise the $10K, to provide more opportunities for women to change their own lives through entrepreneurship and learning.

How We're Going To Do It

We are already half way to $10,000, inspired by an anonymous donation of $5K that came in, challenging us to match it!

We are giving ourselves from now until November 16th to raise the rest. Starting today, we will email you every Friday (only once a week! only for two more times!), always sending inspiration too, of course.

So you are slowly weaned off of our daily images of awesomeness :) We hope you have enjoyed being a part of this push with us, and that you will stay with us until the end - as we define it!

Our Work

Here is more information about Unmarked Streets and the programs this funding supports. 95% of this funding goes towards running our programs, with only 5% going towards operational expenses:

Unmarked Streets is a non-profit in Guatemala that trains women to become entrepreneurs while selling a product that reduces people's environmental impact and improves their quality of life.  

That's called a win-win-win. We don’t give a handout; we give people the tools to walk on their own two feet.

We promote and distribute products that hit one or more of our three charitable objectives: the environment, public health, and education. We have identified these as the three main drivers that keep families trapped in the cycle of poverty.  We have two main community programs that work towards our vision.

The Sales Program

We train local women to be entrepreneurs: show them how to run their own businesses, and let them put those skills into practice by selling Unmarked Streets products. They learn how to run a business in a way that helps them, while helping their community at the same time.

Our first product is a clean burning cook stove, which burns firewood more efficiently. It saves the family time and money on buying or collecting firewood, improves respiratory health from reduced smoke inhalation, improves air quality, and reduces deforestation. We are also adding children’s vitamins, sold in upcycled containers, to our suite of products.

Upcycling and Urban Sustainability (UUS) Education Program

We want to reach out to more people than just those who are buying and selling our products. We want to provide tools and skills for people to self-improve and protect the environment at the same time.

The UUS Education program is a way to promote this culture shift.  This program teaches innovative workshops that repurpose recycled materials into products ranging from jewelry to household decorations to environmentally friendly household goods. The products have resale value, promote healthier and more ecological ways of living, and develop students’ entrepreneurial spirit.

There are so many ways you can contribute

If it's not the right time for you to donate, please:

  • Like us on facebook. https://www.facebook.com/UnmarkedStreets
  • Share our story with your friends. http://unmarkedstreets.org/
  • Volunteer with us in Guatemala. Email: Denise@unmarkedstreets.org

Thank. You.

story:
Send Students to Prospectives '12 International Festival of Digital Art!

We seek funding to help send graduate and Phd level students to Prospectives '12 International Festival of Digital Art.  This is the third iteration of our festival which is soley focused on showcasing the work of current graduate and Phd students exploring the creative, interdisciplinary use of digital technologies in their work.  An international call for entries resulted in 84 works for review, of these, 40 have been accepted for the festival by the jury. Any student who was officially enrolled in a graduate or Phd program during the 2012 calendar year was eligible to submit work.

Prospectives focuses entirely upon highlighting the work of graduate student artists, from a range of disciplines, who utilize and experiment with digital media.  This year's festival includes a one-month exhibition in the University’s Sheppard Fine Arts Gallery and other campus venues, such as Present, a day-long symposium of student creative work in the JCSU Theatre; and Project-Sound, a thrilling video screening and surround-sound event in the Fleishmann Planetarium’s Skydome; as well as temporary public art events, experimental works made specifically for the Internet; and a live performance art event at the Nevada Museum of Art.
 
The majority of events are FREE and open to the public!
 
Visit our archive websites for our 2006 and 2009 festivals! 
Prospectives 09 International Festival of Digital Art
Reno International Festival of New Media 2006

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $5,000 to provide travel grants to worthy students
  • What you will get is the satisfaction of knowing that you have helped to support emerging artists to participate in a unique and significant international media festival.  You will also receive recognition in festival publications (programs, website, etc) as well as selected gifts depending upon your level of funding.
  • All funds donated will go direclty to the students!  We provide specific travel grants to round-trip flights to and from Reno.  These range from $200 to over $1000 for non-U.S. based students.  The majority of our grants are in the $300 range. 

The Impact

The Prospectives Festival is often the first opportunity for young, emerging artists to share their work in such a professional context.  This event truly changes lives!  The temporary community that is established by providing funding for the students to travel to the festival is crucial!  These students are so appreciative of the opportunity to travel to Reno, show their works while also interacting with each other and our community.  This festival changes lives!  Both for the students and for our local students and members of the Reno community and beyond. 

  • Funding goes direclty to students! Your funding will go directly to support the awarding of travel grants to individual students to attend and participate in Prospectives '12.
  • Your funding may go twice as far!  We encourage all travel grant recipients to seek matching funding from their individual schools.  Many students are able to use our grants to leverage funding to further support their attendance to Prospectives. 
  • 80% of festival funding goes to students! This is the third offering of our festival, historically our 2006 and 2009 events involved approximately 80% of the festival budget being allocated towards travel grants for students - we anticipate a similar level of funding/travel awards for the 2012 festival. 
  • At present we have secured funding to allow us to bring in roughly 2/3rds of the selected students.  Your donation will help us as we work towards our goal of fund all the accepted students to travel to the festival! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Would you like to get involved?

  • Volunteer to assist with the festival!
  • If you live in Reno, offer to put up a graduate student for a few nights during the festival!
  • Share this fundraising campaign with your friends and family!
  • Spread the word about our festival!
  • Visit Reno and attend Prospectives!

Thank you for your time!

story:
about our team

 

We are a small high school FIRST robotics team from Midland, MI.  We build a 100lb robot in 6 weeks to meet a challenge and compete with other teams in Michigan. We just found out that we've qualified for the Championships in St. Louis, MO but we don't have the funds to go.  This is an incredible honor and opportunity for the team.  We are hoping that you can help.

what we need

 

We need roughly $11,000 to pay the entrance fees and the travel costs for our team to attend the Championships.  We are fundraising locally but our timeline is tight, so we're using every resource available.

the impact of helping us

FIRST encourages students of all ages to focus on STEM (Science, Teachnology, Engineering, Mathematics) fields and careers in order to continually better ourselves and our society.  Being a part of an robotics team gives students hands-on, real-world experience and education (while being fun!).  Going to the Championships will give us a greater understanding of STEM in the world and encourage cooperation with mutliple nationalities (over 60 countries send teams) to solve the world's problems.
