story:
7/13 Update: Now that we're beyond the goal...

I can put extra money raised toward SUPPLIES!

Yes, when I land in Quito, the other volunteers and I will brainstorm what we'll do and then go shopping for what we can buy to help make this an amazing experience for the kids, whether that is art supplies, game items, or other cool stuff!

So THANK YOU for your contributions, and you can keep 'em coming!

 

Join this crazy ride...

My name is Nathan Agin, and I'm a location-independent nomad. I've been on the road for almost three years, living out of a backpack, and now I'm excited for my NEXT adventure...

I'm joining International Volunteer HQ (www.volunteerhq.org) to spend 2 weeks in Quito, Ecuador to work with the Street Children program:

 

Work involves children of all ages and consists of helping with basic school lessons, playing with the children, singing and dancing, providing hygiene awareness (such as teaching the importance of washing hands) and introducing them to activities (such as painting) that they have not been exposed to previously.

 
This project is important to me for 3 reasons:
  1. Foreign Travel: I've never been to South America and I'm excited to immerse myself in a new culture, meet new people, see different places, and leave with new ideas.
  2. Family Time: my brother is coming with me, and it's going to be an awesome opportunity to spend more time with him.
  3. Giving Back: to devote two weeks to this program, to work with these kids, to experience that connection, and to help them better their lives—that is going to be amazing!

 

By contributing to this project, YOU are directly connected to ALL THREE of these items—

  • you are supporting me in my quest to push my comfort zone and expand my perspectives
  • you are helping me spend more time with the people I love
  • and you are allowing me time to put my life on hold and just focus on these kids.

You're a pretty amazing person. :)

mi hermano Jamie y yo (practicing my español!)

 

What This Costs

IVHQ is one of the most affordable volunteering programs out there (woohoo!)—and here are what the funds will go to:

  • $400 - Ecuador Program Fees (room/meals/organization)
  • $260 - IVHQ Registration Fees
  • $25 - Background Check (for the program)
  • $130 - Travel Insurance (required)
  • $130 - 20 hour Spanish Course
  • $260 - Travel in country, weekly/misc. expenses
  • $150 - Fees for indiegogo and PayPal

Total: $1355.

(these are solely my costs; this does not include my brother's trip)

 

The campaign is set up that WHATEVER is raised, I will receive—and I'm extremely appreciative for that. As I mention in the video, I have already covered all this (with a credit card), so I'm going either way—it'd just be nicer to have a way to pay for all of it when I get back. :)

Again, as I list out all the expenses, it's a bit crazy that I'm doing this right now, but I so trust that it's the right thing to do, and that it will all work out in the end.

One thing I did *NOT* list (and often the most expensive part) is my flight to and from Ecuador; I already paid for that—and it was only $62. Yes, you read that right, and no, I'm not flying in cargo. Perhaps that's something you want me to teach you...? ;)

 

What You Can Get

This isn't all about me—no way! It's about how I can HELP and be of SERVICE, not only to those kids in Ecuador, but also to YOU, too!
 
So how can I help you? Maybe I can GIVE you something, or DO something for you, or TEACH you something?? What do you need?
 
Here's what I know I can offer:
  • My COOKBOOK AND NUTRITIONAL GUIDE, "Nonstop Awesomeness in the Kitchen"—30 recipes and 60+ pages of ideas plus bonuses! (see www.nonstopawesomeness.com/cookbook for more info)

 

  • My "$5 FLIGHT TO HAWAII" Virtual Course—learn how to get there for a fraction of the cost! (more info here: http://www.nonstopawesomeness.me/book-5-dollar-flight-to-hawaii-course)

 

  • To help you with your WEBSITE, BLOG, NEWSLETTER, or other ONLINE/COMPUTER tasks—receive ONE HOUR of my time as a Virtual Assistant (more ideas: www.virtualnathan.com)
 
  • Get a 30-minute Skype or phone call to learn about HOW TO MEDITATE, HEALTHY EATING/COOKING, PLAYING THE UKULELE, BUDGET TRAVEL, OR SPEAKING SHAKESPEARE!
 
 
And if there's SOMETHING ELSE you can think of that I can give, do, or teach, I'm happy to chat about that!
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not able to contribute with dollars and cents, please consider:

  • Getting the word out to others you know and making some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know about this on Facebook, Twitter, email, etc!

 

And finally, once again... THANK YOU!!

Here's what I know I can offer:



My COOKBOOK AND NUTRITIONAL GUIDE, "Nonstop Awesomeness in the Kitchen"—30 recipes and 60+ pages of ideas plus bonuses! (see www.nonstopawesomeness.com/cookbook for more info)



 




My "$5 FLIGHT TO HAWAII" Virtual Course—learn how to get there for a fraction of the cost! (more info here: http://www.nonstopawesomeness.me/book-5-dollar-flight-to-hawaii-course)



 




To help you with your WEBSITE, BLOG, NEWSLETTER, or other ONLINE/COMPUTER tasks—receive ONE HOUR of my time as a Virtual Assistant (more ideas: www.virtualnathan.com)




 


Get a 30-minute Skype or phone call to learn about HOW TO MEDITATE, HEALTHY EATING/COOKING, PLAYING THE UKULELE, BUDGET TRAVEL, OR SPEAKING SHAKESPEARE!



 
 
And if there's SOMETHING ELSE you can think of that I can give, do, or teach, I'm happy to chat about that!
 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you're not able to contribute with dollars and cents, please consider:


Getting the word out to others you know and making some noise about this campaign.

Use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know about this on Facebook, Twitter, email, etc!


 
And finally, once again... THANK YOU!!

story:
What is the Project?

A Consumer Class Action against Chase Bank regarding their mortgage practices. A consumer class action, by consumers and for consumers.

What is the project specifically?

We will be suing Chase Bank in California in a Class Action for Wrongful Foreclosure and Fraudulent Unjust Enrichment (along with other charges) under the CLRA and Business and Professional Code 17200 (along with other statutes). We have the initial complaint mostly done and will be completing it as the fund-raising is going on. We plan to file no later than June 30th, 2011 barring any acts of God or Government.

Why should I believe you?

We have over 15 years of direct experience in these fields. We have thousands of pages of documents and hundreds of pages of notes relating to this matter. We have been researching this issue since November 2010 when it was first brought to our attention. We do legal research for a living and have been retained by law firms to teach them how to litigate on matters of this nature.

I don't understand what the big deal is?

JP Morgan Chase arranged to buy approximately $400 billion worth of assets from the FDIC back in 2008.

Due to multiple lawsuits surrounding those assets, the transaction between the FDIC and Chase has never closed and therefore Chase does not yet own these assets.

Imagine if someone arranged to buy a large apartment complex. The would-be purchaser puts a deposit on the property and signs a contract to purchase the building. The closing date on the contract is six months from the date the contract is signed. Now imagine that there are MULTIPLE lawsuits contesting who actually owns the building and also whether or not the seller had the right to sell the building in the first place.

Now here is the important part: the purchaser (Chase), before the deal has closed, starts to collect rent and evict tenants, even though they aren't the owners of the property yet. Now imagine that the closing date on the contract keeps getting set to some point in the future. While this is going on the buyer (Chase) continues to collect rents and evict people. THIS IS ILLEGAL!!! You can't exercise rights that you don't have.

You can not evict (foreclose) people without actually owning the property! It is just common sense. And just FYI, you can't legally collect the rent (mortgage) payments either...

This means that anyone who had a Washington Mutual loan may have a claim against Chase Bank.

We have found a few of those people and we are actively pursuing a Class Action against Chase Bank in California. We will be suing on behalf of everyone in California who was wronged. Why California? Because there are very consumer friendly laws here that allow non-lawyers (read: consumers) to sue on behalf of other consumers for the injustices they all suffered. It also doesn't hurt that California contains roughly 35% or more of all of Washington Mutual's loan portfolio, making it the largest and friendliest venue for this action.

Can we prevail on our own?

No, we need your support to do this. Otherwise we will likely be railroaded by the bank's attorneys.

Why don't you just get an attorney on board for this?

We have spoken with a number of plaintiff-side class action firms in San Francisco and Los Angeles and they have so far declined to take the case for two main reasons.

One: This isn't their specialty and they won't make the time to read everything that we've read (thousands of pages).

Two: This isn't a good bet for them economically. Foreclosure law has been notoriously unpredictable in the past and law firms are hurting financially right now.The firms that we have talked to aren't willing currently to risk large sums of money just to have the government or the courts weighing in with some ridiculous statement like, "The banks aren't held to that law like everyone else is."

We will be continuing to speak with other class-action firms and one may be inspired by the community support that we bring and take the case on alongside us.

NONE OF THE LAW FIRMS HAVE SAID THAT THERE IS NOT A CLAIM HERE.

Are we afraid?

To be honest, a little bit. Chase is the largest corporation in the world by asset volume. Only with a massive outpouring of public support will we be able to win this. We plan to reach out to politicians for support as well, but we need your support to show that this is a populist issue before they will take the time to look at it. You already know what you can do to make a difference, click that big button and donate!

What will we be doing with the money?

We have launched a website at www.chaseaction.com where we will be chronicling our efforts against Chase in a weekly web-series. We will cover case updates and educating people about the theory and back-story of this whole WAMU / Chase transaction. We will also be using the site to help identify potential members of the class.

If we raise a LOT of money...

We will use it to promote the issue on as many public forums as possible. Newspapers, billboards, TV, web ads, anything and everything to get the message out. And lastly, we will be using some small amounts to live on while we work on this full time. We currently do not have to pay for rent and have basically no overhead short of cell-phone and internet bills. There could potentially be travel and other such expenses so literally every dollar counts!

So what are the rewards?

Justice Badges. They will be hand cast and customized by local artists and craftsmen/women in the San Francisco area. The Justice Badge tells everyone that you supported the cause of Justice!

T-shirts are up for grabs as well.

On the front the shirt reads, "I supported a class action lawsuit against Chase Bank and all I got was this lousy t-shirt." On the back it says, "www.chaseaction.com"

Credits in the web-series are available, as well as lunches with us (Jason and Sean and team) and seminars around the country. If you would like us to present on the information that we have in more detail we would be happy to!

Perhaps through our efforts we can initiate further class actions in other states so that everyone may be afforded the same level of justice. We are happy to answer all questions regarding this issue.

If you are curious as to whether or not this could apply to you, please go to our website at www.chaseaction.com and fill out the web-form and we will get back to you as soon as possible. And lastly, we are not lawyers, and nothing here is to be construed as legal advice. Just saying. ;)

Thank You All and Lets Show Big Business that they Aren't Above the Law!

story:
SAVE THE NHS !

On the 16th August I will join the 'Dial 999 for the NHS March' from Jarrow, walking 300 miles to Westminster to petition politicians to stop the break up and privatisation of the NHS. The walk will take 3 weeks, sleeping some nights in community centres but other nights, I will have to find a hotel. Every day, 7 days a week, I will walk up to 16 miles.

WHY am I doing this walk?

1  To stop the continued privatisation of the National Health Service and the creaming off of tax payers money to pay shareholders.

2  To keep the NHS a universal health service ‘free at the point of need.’

3  To stop the sell off of much needed NHS property and assets to private companies.

I am training hard for this trip but I need your support to fund it: The money will pay for the train fare to Jarrow then home from London, some budget hotels, healthy fuel to keep me going, cushioned running shoes to protect my joints from 300 miles on tarmac and 3 or 4 “Save the NHS” T shirts. Any money I don’t use will support other people on the march. Even if you cannot afford to contribute please support me ('like' my FB page) and follow my progress on the march on Facebook and Twitter.

In respect for your hard earned cash my ‘perks’ cost me effort, not money and if I don't reach my goal then you can be sure that every contribution will be that much more important in helping me to achieve my goal of motivating people through the country to stand up and protect the NHS.

My perks include Postcards from this unique 21st century Jarrow March, my FB roll of honour and regular tweets from the march.

    Risks & Challenges

    My Physiotherapist and my GP have given me advice and an exercise plan. I do not underestimate the challenge of walking every day without a break but SOMEBODY MUST DO IT.

story:
My Background

My name is Brandon Norris, and I am a maker. I was one of the pioneers of 3D printing when I designed and built a bootstrap 3D printer in 2009. I am a founding member of the Omaha Maker Group, and have been on its Board of Directors from the day it was incorporated.

My latest project was designing and building a automatic Drink Bot with some wood, an Arduino, and a few motors. I've constructed a wide array of other projects that include a motorized skateboard, a tri-copter, casting aluminum, and a laser-cut wire bender.

My passion for making also extends to digital creations. I've written the firmware for several Arduino projects, and wrote a Python program to convert the code generated by a 3D slicing program into a format my homemade 3D printer could understand. I also attend OMG!Code meetings held at the Omaha Maker Group.

Omaha Code School

I have been accepted into one of the 16 seats for the inaugural session of Omaha Code School, an intense 12-week class that teaches its students how to become developers. I am prepared to tackle all 84 days head on, and learn as much as I can about professional development.

However, the cost for the program is steep. I could use all the help I can get to pay for it. Your contribution will go directly to help pay for the $6000 tuition.

After my time at code school, I plan to give a talk about my experience at an OMG!Code meeting.

Please help me go to code school!

story:
Our Efforts Will Empower Kids to Touch the Stars!

This is our CAPITAL CAMPAIGN Web site. If you want to buy coffee please visit our Web store

HELP US FUND YOUTH IN AVIATION PROGRAMS!»


Flying High Coffee was started by a certified flight instructor who's passion is equal parts education, aviation and high-grade coffee.


CONTRIBUTE BY CLICKING LINKS TO THE RIGHT - ANY AMOUNT»


We offer ultra-fresh, top-grade Arabica coffee beans for consumption in homes, offices and aviation environments throughout the US. This capital campaign fund will allow us to jump start coffee sales. We will then donate an amount equal to the fund amount directly to scholarships for kids.


Next to jet fuel, coffee is the most important and ubiquitous liquid in aviation and aerospace. Coffee is also the world's second most traded commodity next to oil.


We will harness a portion of the tens of millions of dollars spent on aviation's favorite beverage and channel it into programs to introduce kids to aviation and build within them the skills, knowledge and maturity that a future in aviation will warrant.


Aviation Makes Kids Better People

Aviation and the aerospace industry offer a rich, exciting and dynamic environment for education. Subjects range from math, science, physics and physiology to intra-personal relations, law, safety and weather.


HELP US CREATE PERPETUALLY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS FOR KIDS - USE LINKS ON RIGHT»


Many schools have caught on to the limitless teaching opportunities and exciting hands-on exercises that aviation offers youth. Very few organizations are working directly to involve and attract more youth to the opportunities and diverse vocations found in aviation and aerospace.


Our programs will provide funds in the form of scholarships to send kids to aviation camps and obtain hands on training and skills-building in the field of aviation. Kids will learn to build, fly and repair aircraft as they develop confidence, self-esteem, cooperation and leadership skills they can use throughout their lives.


Humanity Needs This!

The world increasingly relies upon the aviation industry for business, travel, global security, rescue, wildlife management, commerce, space exploration and so much more. Industry analysts predict a shortage of pilots and other skilled aerospace workers in the very near future.


FUND SPACE EXPLORERS OF TOMORROW - USE LINKS ON RIGHT»


Also, humanity has begun a new age of privatized space travel. The sky is no longer the limit and we need our kids to be ready for a future that holds exciting opportunities for advancements and achievement.


What We Need & What You Get

Flying High Coffee, LLC has been bootstrapped. All systems are operational. A market test was conducted in July 2010 and met with an overwhelmingly positive response. People in aviation, from world-class aerobatic champions to Federal agency employees to bush pilots and barnstormers loved the fresh coffee (and the concept of giving profits back to youth programs).


We now need an additional $50,000 to launch our product, fund a sales event and execute on strategic industry partnerships. We will use these partnerships to bring our product and message to the aviation and aerospace marketplace. Cash is needed to acquire coffee brewing equipment, purchase high-grade coffee beans and process it in our micro-roasting facility and to buy supplies necessary to bring our high quality product to a very large aviation-centric exposition.


This event will generate revenue which will be used to establish our first scholarships as well as fuel ongoing marketing and outreach efforts. Exposure at this event along with leveraging cultivated industry relationships will drive sales of coffee from our on line coffee store (www.flyinghighcoffee.com) for perpetual recurring revenue.


Our plan involves one show in 2011 and 3-5 shows in 2012, all in support of the on line sales of freshly roasted coffee which, in turn supports the youth programs.


This funding effort is one important piece of our overall funding strategy, which includes significant investment from a few private sources as well as an SBA backed bank loan.


Once our company is up-and-running, an amount equal to the initial amount raised will be paid into a scholarship program - effectively 100% of the money raised here will go directly to youth in aviation programs!


Other Ways You Can Help

How many people do you know who can't face the day without their beloved cup of coffee? Is the coffee they are drinking fresh? Fresh tastes good. Is it supporting a good cause? Supporting feels good.


You can elevate their coffee experience as well as yours by bringing our project to their attention. Send them an e-mail, use the sharing links provided, tweet about us - get the word out with us. Thanks in advance!


(P.S. You don't have to be a pilot to enjoy Flying High Coffee... but it helps!)

story:
We are Studio Bobcats, a student business team in the graduate design program at the California College of Arts. We're developing an amazing app for a class competition, and we need your help.

Rock it! is an app designed to help children age 7-12 master a musical instrument by making practice sessions more rewarding and fun. Rather than using the tablet as the teacher, our app aims to enhance, rather than replace, human instruction. The tablet, smartphone and web versions of Rock it! form a unique 'practice ecosystem' where parents and teachers can remain actively involved in a student's progress without nagging or causing relationship stress.

For Kids

Parents and children set up Rock it! together, establishing practice times, duration, and rewards. Before a practice session, Rock it! runs a student through a helpful checklist to make sure they're focused and ready to play. During practice, Rock it! blocks access to other apps and incoming texts, reducing distractions. After practice, Rock it! provides a number of compelling, customizable gamified 'progress experiences' to encourage kids to keep at it.

The key to Rock it! is our reward system. In addition to earning digital reward badges for display on our private, secure in-app social network, kids can also get stickers, temporary tattoos and iron-on badges (purchased by parents through our smartphone app) to mark major practice milestones.

 

 

For Parents

Rock it! helps parents and guardians stay on top of their child's practice regimen without resorting to nagging. A special smartphone app, Rock it! Dashboard, allows busy parents to monitor their child's practice schedule, track progress, send encouraging messages and re-order reward packs on the go. The Rock it! Dashboard allows multiple caregivers to check progress on the same Rock it! account independently, smoothing relations when a child is moving back and forth between two households.

What if they don't practice? Rock it! can notice an individual student's practice patterns and make connections to provide support if practice drops off. Rock it! will send encouraging personal emails to the student and motivational strategies to the parent. If a certain item on the pre-practice checklist is regularly being ignored, Rock it! can gently encourage parents to focus on this area.

For Teachers

Teachers can use Rock it! Dashboard to monitor multiple students' progress from one smartphone app. Additionally, Rock it! can send progress reports to a simplified web portal or via email, if the music instructor is using school facilities or doesn't have a smartphone.


Features

• Supportive, encouraging practice-assistance environment

• Distraction elimination through configurable time-limited push notification lockouts

• Student-customizable 'coolboard' of favorite artists, images and sound clips for inspiration

• Tangible reward packs of stickers, temporary tattoos and iron-on badges

• Safe, secure in-app social network for encouraging or competing against friends

• Web and email interfaces for music teacher

• At-a-glance mobile app dashboard for parents

• Supported on iOS and Android smartphone/tablet platforms, with a web interface for teachers and a smartphone dashboard interface for parents. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need your support. Each $1 donation to Rock it! counts as a vote of support; the more votes, the more likely Rock it! is to win. You can only vote once!

If we win, we will donate all funds collected by the entire class to Musequality, a charity that supports music education in developing countries.


The Impact

Rock it! can help children learn to love to practice. It can help parents at the end of their rope cultivate new motivational strategies for encouraging their children. It can smooth the relational stress of motivation by providing a neutral ground for separated caregivers to stay up to date on their kids' activities.  

We live in a stressful world, full of distractions. Rock it!'s short-term goal is instrument mastery, but in the long term, our app can help kids develop the focus and responsibility to handle whatever life throws at them.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help make Rock it! a reality. Use the share tools on this page to let your friends know about our app – every vote helps. Thanks so much.

If a certain item on the pre-practice checklist is regularly being ignored, Rock it! can gently encourage parents to focus on this area.

For Teachers
Teachers can use Rock it! Dashboard to monitor multiple students' progress from one smartphone app. Additionally, Rock it! can send progress reports to a simplified web portal or via email, if the music instructor is using school facilities or doesn't have a smartphone.

Features
• Supportive, encouraging practice-assistance environment
• Distraction elimination through configurable time-limited push notification lockouts
• Student-customizable 'coolboard' of favorite artists, images and sound clips for inspiration
• Tangible reward packs of stickers, temporary tattoos and iron-on badges
• Safe, secure in-app social network for encouraging or competing against friends
• Web and email interfaces for music teacher
• At-a-glance mobile app dashboard for parents
• Supported on iOS and Android smartphone/tablet platforms, with a web interface for teachers and a smartphone dashboard interface for parents. 

What We Need & What You Get
We need your support. Each $1 donation to Rock it! counts as a vote of support; the more votes, the more likely Rock it! is to win. You can only vote once!
If we win, we will donate all funds collected by the entire class to Musequality, a charity that supports music education in developing countries.

The Impact
Rock it! can help children learn to love to practice. It can help parents at the end of their rope cultivate new motivational strategies for encouraging their children. It can smooth the relational stress of motivation by providing a neutral ground for separated caregivers to stay up to date on their kids' activities.  
We live in a stressful world, full of distractions. Rock it!'s short-term goal is instrument mastery, but in the long term, our app can help kids develop the focus and responsibility to handle whatever life throws at them.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can still help make Rock it! a reality. Use the share tools on this page to let your friends know about our app – every vote helps. Thanks so much.

story:
Our Story

In December 2009, twelve medical students packed their suitcases full of medical supplies, and with eager hearts, left for Ahmedabad, India. Our mission: To provide health care and services to the patients of Civil Hospital and aid with village health programs during our six day stay.  We call ourselves ESCape to India: Education*Service*Culture. ESCape to India is composed of medical student volunteers dedicated to bringing health and hope to those who are less fortunate.  We are an entirely student-run, and student-founded organization. We currently have twenty members, and continue to expand our presence. 

 


Poverty and lack of medical care are daily obstacles to many of the people of India.  Those of working age have left their villages for the cities in pursuit of jobs, leaving a town composed mostly of children and the elderly. As a group of medical students and professionals, we will use our collective knowledge and skills to address the health needs of the communities we serve.
 
More than just medicine is needed to improve the long-term health of the people we serve, and ESCape to India takes great strides to educate the population regarding the causes of these illnesses and the appropriate measures that can be taken to prevent them. The purpose of our first trip was primarily to make a community assessment, using interviews with villagers and focus group discussions following our stay in the city. In doing so, we collected demographic information to better understand where our efforts are needed most. Assessments showed that reproductive screening and management is an aspect of health that can be improved upon. Therefore, we plan to use monetary donations to purchase equipment and supplies for Pap smear screenings. Additionally, wound infections are commonly seen amongst the villagers; providing supplies and education of wound care will certainly augment community health. 
 
Our vision and commitment is to return every year to the clinic and continue with medical follow-up and further address the health needs of the community by putting even more emphasis on education and long-term preventive medicine. Over the coming year, we will be actively fundraising and creating cultural awareness within our medical community to be able to return to our "adopted" village in Rangpur - a 4 hour journey from Baroda, India -  with a physician, an abundance of supplies, and instruments. With these resources, villagers will be able to have access to more comprehensive medical care.  Our preventive health measures include recruiting dental health professionals and providing education on dental hygiene, sexual health, and chronic disease prevention. 

The Impact

 

In December 2009, we provided Rangpur village with 0.5 lakh rupees (US $1000) towards medical supplies and surgical costs. We treated 300+ patients with help from local translators and physicians recruited by the Shroff Foundation. This visit enabled us to understand cultural values and resources needed for future planning and development. One-fourth of the donations went to Civil Hospital's Patient Services Department, providing basic needs for patients during their hospitalization.  

 

The remaining three-fourths were given to Rangpur village for surgical operations and measured through patients' pre/post-operative documentation. On our next trip, we will track patients seen with specific management plans using EMR to better tailor supplies and assistance needed, measure the number of medical supplies distributed, quantify health awareness through follow-up surveys, and conduct "training the trainer" workshops so that villagers can continue screening and preventive health education.

 

For this, we need financial support - most of us are funding our travel and stay in India completely out of pocket, and rely on the generosity of those like you to help provide sustainable health care changes to Rangpur village in Baroda.

 

 

What We Need ...

 

Health Fair Clinic Supplies $1,500 Hand sanitizer, Alcohol wipes, hydrogen peroxide, bandages, fingerstick glucose monitors, thermometers, blood pressure cuffs, gloves, lotions, etc.
Educational Materials $500 To prepare and distribute educational materials, such as markers, posterboard, books, toiletries, etc.
Surgical supplies for recruited surgeons $1,000 To allow for sterile field and medical instruments, sterile coverings, etc. in order to conduct necessary surgical procedures.
Translators $100 To translate the medical jargon in the patients native dialect for better patient compliance and understanding of medical treatment.
Medication from local Indian pharmacy $1,000 Local antibiotics, antifungals, NSAIDS, antihypertensives, antidiabetics, bronchodilators, etc. to allow for easy access to medication year-round.
Literacy Classes $400 Books, computers, writing material to already established literacy programs to encourage proficiency.
Electronic Medical Records $1,000 To aid in continuous documentation and follow-up sustainable care of patient population.
Patient Comfort Supplies $500 To provide patients and their families comfort care while they are waiting to be seen, such as blankets, food, water, etc.


 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word and help the people of Baroda by sharing this link!! Thank you; your efforts and support will ensure that this effort continues to happen year after year.

story:
Meet Camry

My name is Camry Wilkins and I am going into my junior year of high school at Newton County High School. I have been selected as a Forum Scholar by George Mason University to attend the National Youth Leadership Forum on National Security (NYLF/NS): Exploring American Diplomacy, Intelligence and Defense in Washington, D.C. September 25-30th.

I am an honor student and a marching and symphonic band member. My goal for the future is to attend college or a national military academy and then serve our country as a military officer or government official as a national or international leader.

While attending the Forum, I will explore some of our country's most technologically advanced military facilities, policy centers, historical sites and monuments. I will learn from some of our nation's foremost decision makers, diplomats and military leaders — all charged with keeping our nation safe. I will meet leaders from:

  • The Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)
  • The Pentagon
  • The United States Naval Academy

I will also visit Foreign Embassies such as Israel, Japan and Saudi Arabia.

Your contribution will help me get to the forum and start my journey into national service.

My Asking

I have a minimum fundraising goal of $2,500.00, which is the total cost for attending the Forum and airfare.

Raising this kind of money in a social campaign is a BIG goal. You have all heard the saying, "It takes a village to raise a child." I am hoping to unite a village to make attending the Forum a reality.

  • Give $10 - If 250 individuals donate $10 each, I will meet our goal.
  • Give $50 - If 50 families to donate $50 each, I will meet our goal.
  • Give $100 - If 25 individuals or familes donate $100 each, I will meet our goal.

Funds will be dispersed via an account in my name directly to George Mason University payable to the National Youth Leadership Forum on National Security and the airline when booking the flight.

Thank you for helping me achieve my dream!

story:
Short Summary

I am Bobby and I am in middle school.  I am 13 years old and for my Bar Mitzvah project I am trying to raise money for the kids who are hurricane victims of the recent Hurricane Sandy.  I will collect this money and give it to the Red Cross at the end of this project.  This is important because I am learning to make a difference in the world.  I feel sorry for those kids because they lost all their stuff.  I would like to get them back what they lost or at least help.  In an emergency I would appreciate all the help I could get.

What We Need

I put in $5, would you give at least $5 or more to my project?  You will be helping me with my project and helping kids to get back on their feet.  $500 is my goal.  Whatever I earn will go to the Red Cross for kids.

The Impact

I hope you want to help like I do.  I heard about Hurricane Sandy on television, in school, on the internet, on facebook, youtube...really everywhere.  It looked devistating.  I think any amount you and I can raise will help.

Please forward this email to your friends.

Thank you for your consideration of my project, "The Kids of Sandy".
 
Sincerely,
 
Bobby N.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Barry McClean and I would like to introduce "The Smart Bib". Originally starting out as a school project, the Bib has since developed into a product of its own. The Smart Bib is an electronic learning tool for young children that utilizes pre-recorded and/or custom songs to help with the learning process of the basics such as ABC's, 123's and music. Most commonly used for educational purposes, the Smart Bib has the potential to outshine traditional learning methods given a chance. The Smart Bib is self contained and can be disassembled for cleaning easily.  

    The funding I am requesting will go towards configuring and upgrading the components of the current Bib. The goal of the Smart Bib concept is to be able to submit a fully functional improved prototype for industry submission. As stated in the demonstration video, funds are required for the steps needed to prepare the Smart Bib improvements such as: CAD drawings, virtual prototypes, concept designing and licensing for marketing and product adoption.

    Unfortunately there is no immediate mass production plan in the works, so an actual model of the Smart Bib will not be available at the current time for the public. I would however like to offer Smart Bib supporter t-shirts instead. 

    Whether or not the financial goal is reached, the Smart Bib is an important learning tool for children. As mentioned previously, this is a patent pending product. I feel strongly about its use and impact on helping to educate our children. I will continue to make improvements and push for mass production.  As you will see in the sample video the reaction of the child using the Smart Bib, she already responded positively despite having it only for a very brief period. It is easy to imagine what impact months of exposure to the child would hold. 

    The main obstacles I have faced so far was the redesigning of the layout, the playback audio quality, and the actual Bib housing.  The layout was reconfigured and the internal components were improved. If these can be corrected, then the project will go much smoother and it will take far less time to be in the hands of awaiting children and parents. 

    Feel free to contact me with any pre or post campaign questions or concerns.  smartbib21@gmail.com

story:
Hi, I'm Conor!

I'm 16 years old and I just recently received a partial Scholarship for Berklee College of Music's 5 Week Summer Performance Program. Will you help me with the rest of the fees to make this dream come true?

I am a sophomore in high school and have had a love for creating music since I was born, singing and playing many instruments.  I write and perform pop rock-style music--think Billy Joel and Elton John. I also create music videos for YouTube and do local gigs with my Band. I also spend a huge amount of time producing my own music.  I just released my first album, Grounded - EP.

My dream is to be a professional musician, and I'm going to make it happen.

Here is a Playlist of some Official Music Videos for my Originals!


Summer at Berklee!

Berklee College of Music in Boston is the world's leading contemporary music school and includes all my interests, from performance to producing, so when I heard about Berklee's Five-Week Summer Performance Program I just couldn't resist. Spending five weeks learning from music-industry pros with a thousand other talented and passionate young musicians from all over the world truly sounds like a Dream Come True!

This program is especially exciting for me because it contains Top Of The Line classes on songwriting, vocal technique, stage performance, musician training, and the Music Industry. I think all of these classes, along with just being in the awesome environment, soaking up the knowledge and making great connections will radically change and improve the way I see and create music. I look forward to how much better the content I produce for you guys will be when I come back from this great program.


Will You Help this Dream Come True?

I received a $1,500 Scholarship from Berklee to attend this super awesome summer program, but I still need help to cover the rest of the tuition and room & board. So please chip in so we can make this dream become a reality together!

The initial cost of the program, including Tuition, Room & Board, and other fees is right around $8,300 USD. Then deduct the amount I received from the Scholarship and add on IndieGoGo fees and Reward Costs and it brings the final number to $7,200 USD. This final number represents what I need to cover the expenses to attend this program without being in debt for it. 

The Berklee 5-Week Summer Performance Program goes from July 12 to August 15, 2014. There is also a showcase at the end of the five weeks that all friends, family and backers are invited to, if you are in or headed to the Boston area.


Thank You!

So now that you've learned a little about me and this wonderful program, take a look at some of the links in my bio for more Conor James Music and information, and thank you so much for Your Support!

Also, check out all the Awesome Perks available for Funders!


Please be aware when Contributing, that on this Campaign:

I WILL KEEP WHAT I RAISE, EVEN IF I DON'T REACH MY GOAL! 

I chose this option because, If I don't make my goal on Crowdfunding I can take what I get and make the rest of the required funds other ways. Because of this, your wonderful contributions will go straight to me and into my Summer at Berklee savings, when you contribute :)

Thank you for Supporting! I am Super Excited! Please Share!

story:
Why Art Matters

Art touches your life whether you consider yourself to be an artist or not.   Whether you have season tickets to the symphony or watch the latest superhero movies.  These, and everything in between, were brought to the world by artists.  Art as a discipline is often brushed aside, not prioritized or not seen as a measure of intelligence.  You yourself might have once had dreams of being a photographer, but were pushed into something more stable (and maybe a bit more boring) instead. Kids crave creative expression.  When they are young, they tell stories, paint pictures, dance, sing and pretend.  And then many of us lose that along the way.  We get self conscious.  We get serious.  We hide.  And that happens throughout the teen years, but it doesn't have to. I believe it's our responsibility  to encourage artists in their most fragile state- when they are young.  
What is CAMP?

The Community Arts Mentoring Program (CAMP) will be a non-profit center where middle and high schoolers in New York can go to pursue a variety of different artistic disciplines. They will be able to work independently as well as have the benefit of a mentor partnership with a professional artist, musician, dancer, etc.  There are 3 main goals of CAMP.  First it will provide a safe place for young people to go where they can interact in a positive way.  Secondly, it will offer an opportunity for these students to pursue their creativity in ways they may not otherwise cultivate given the depletion of music and art resources in public schools.  This pursuit of mastery will  foster the ability express themselves in a confident, constructive and tangible way through gallery shows, performances and individual portfolios.  Finally, through the mentorship program, young people will be able to develop personal relationships with professional artists who are experts in their respective fields.  This will not only bridge a divide between disparate elements of New York society but also provide a role model students can emulate if they choose to pursue a career in the arts. 

About Me
My name is Lindsay Manolakos.  I've been teaching in public schools in  Brooklyn for almost 10 years. I'm also an artist.  I'm a painter and a writer, and I'm always looking for ways to incorporate creativity in and out of my class because I know the value it can bring to a person's life.  I put on plays where the kids design costumes, paint scenery, build sets and of course, they get to perform.  That is when I see kids come alive.  I see excitement, pride, and leadership.  Before a show even ends, they start talking about the next one.  If they had a choice, they would stay in the school all evening painting, sewing and building if security guards didn't have other plans. This constant request for more, bigger and better art is what  inspired this program.    There are a lot of reasons why kids in East NY might want to stay within the safe walls of a school building.  All of those reasons are why I'm creating CAMP.
I also love biking. I don't ride fast, but I do ride far.   I go on epic(isn) rides around the city and surrounding areas.  And I have a (not so) secret desire to get everyone I know on two wheels.  Therein lies the connection between an art center and a bike-a-thion.
 

What We Need

We are hoping to raise at least $7,500 to cover a lot of the costs associated with starting non-profit.  This includes:

  • Administrative Fees - $2600  (ie State/Fed licensing, legal & consultant fees) 
  • Website development and hosting - $600
  • Fall Benefit Concert costs - $800
  • Marketing materials - $500 (ie promotional video, CAMP brand development)
  • Securing a venue for CAMP for 7/2015 - $2000
We are going to have a number of fundraisers over the course of this year, but this money is needed now because it will allow us to get 501c3 non-profit status and apply for grants as soon as possible.

What we are willing to do

Ride bikes all day!   I am organizing a 75 mile bike ride around Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan.  We will be riding on SATURDAY AUGUST 16th.  (Rain date, Sunday August 17th.  Uber rain date, Saturday august 23rd.)   You can show your support of this campaign by sponsoring that ride or riding yourself!  As much as we need the funds, we'd also really like to have boatloads of people participating in the ride.  This is a community inspired campaign and we'd like as many members of the community supporting us via their checkbook or via their fixie.  You don't have to ride all 75 miles.  You can jump in and out at any of the 6 checkpoints along the way.  If you want to ride, and you didn't get the pdf attachment showing the route and checkpoints, send me an email and I'll send it right over.  camp.lindsaymanolakos@gmail.com 

*All riders must wear a helmet while riding. (That's just common sense) 

*Neither CAMP nor Lindsay Manolakos assumes any responsibility for injuries sustained (including your sore butt) during this ride.   While we encourage lots of participation, you may not want this day to be the day you learn to ride a bike.  

Other Ways You Can Help 
  • If you can't ride, you could meet us at one of the checkpoints with water and cliff bars. (I like the peanut toffee crunch flavor) 
  • Make some noise!   Blow up all your social media accounts and share this with your circles! 
  • If you are an artist, and might be interested in mentoring, please contact me at camp.lindsaymanolakos@gmail.com
  • If you are a business and might be interested in being a sponsor for our fall benefit concert, please email me.
story_txt:
Why Art Matters

Art touches your life whether you consider yourself to be an artist or not.   Whether you have season tickets to the symphony or watch the latest superhero movies.  These, and everything in between, were brought to the world by artists.  Art as a discipline is often brushed aside, not prioritized or not seen as a measure of intelligence.  You yourself might have once had dreams of being a photographer, but were pushed into something more stable (and maybe a bit more boring) instead. Kids crave creative expression.  When they are young, they tell stories, paint pictures, dance, sing and pretend.  And then many of us lose that along the way.  We get self conscious.  We get serious.  We hide.  And that happens throughout the teen years, but it doesn't have to. I believe it's our responsibility  to encourage artists in their most fragile state- when they are young.  What is CAMP?

The
Community Arts Mentoring Program (CAMP) will be a non-profit center where middle and high schoolers in New York can go to
pursue a variety of different artistic disciplines. They will be able to work
independently as well as have the benefit of a mentor partnership with a professional artist, musician, dancer, etc. 
There are 3 main goals of CAMP.  First it will provide a safe place for young people to go where they can
interact in a positive way.  Secondly, it
will offer an opportunity for these students to pursue their creativity in ways they may not otherwise cultivate given the depletion of music and art resources
in public schools.  This pursuit of mastery will  foster the ability express themselves in
a confident, constructive and tangible way through gallery shows, performances
and individual portfolios.  Finally,
through the mentorship program, young people will be able to develop personal
relationships with professional artists who are experts in their respective
fields.  This will not only bridge a
divide between disparate elements of New York society but also provide a role
model students can emulate if they choose to pursue a career in the
arts. 

About MeMy name is Lindsay Manolakos.  I've been teaching in public schools in  Brooklyn for almost 10 years. I'm also an artist.  I'm a painter and a writer, and I'm always looking for ways to incorporate creativity in and out of my class because I know the value it can bring to a person's life.  I put on plays where the kids design costumes, paint scenery, build sets and of course, they get to perform.  That is when I see kids come alive.  I see excitement, pride, and leadership.  Before a show even ends, they start talking about the next one.  If they had a choice, they would stay in the school all evening painting, sewing and building if security guards didn't have other plans. This constant request for more, bigger and better art is what  inspired this program.    There are a lot of reasons why kids in East NY might want to stay within the safe walls of a school building.  All of those reasons are why I'm creating CAMP.I also love biking. I don't ride fast, but I do ride far.   I go on epic(isn) rides around the city and surrounding areas.  And I have a (not so) secret desire to get everyone I know on two wheels.  Therein lies the connection between an art center and a bike-a-thion. 
What We Need
We are hoping to raise at least $7,500 to cover a lot of the costs associated with starting non-profit.  This includes:


Administrative Fees - $2600  (ie State/Fed licensing, legal & consultant fees) 
Website development and hosting - $600
Fall Benefit Concert costs - $800
Marketing materials - $500 (ie promotional video, CAMP brand development)
Securing a venue for CAMP for 7/2015 - $2000

We are going to have a number of fundraisers over the course of this year, but this money is needed now because it will allow us to get 501c3 non-profit status and apply for grants as soon as possible.
 What we are willing to do
Ride bikes all day!   I am organizing a 75 mile bike ride around Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan.  We will be riding on SATURDAY AUGUST 16th.  (Rain date, Sunday August 17th.  Uber rain date, Saturday august 23rd.)   You can show your support of this campaign by sponsoring that ride or riding yourself!  As much as we need the funds, we'd also really like to have boatloads of people participating in the ride.  This is a community inspired campaign and we'd like as many members of the community supporting us via their checkbook or via their fixie.  You don't have to ride all 75 miles.  You can jump in and out at any of the 6 checkpoints along the way.  If you want to ride, and you didn't get the pdf attachment showing the route and checkpoints, send me an email and I'll send it right over.  camp.lindsaymanolakos@gmail.com 
*All riders must wear a helmet while riding. (That's just common sense) 
*Neither CAMP nor Lindsay Manolakos assumes any responsibility for injuries sustained (including your sore butt) during this ride.   While we encourage lots of participation, you may not want this day to be the day you learn to ride a bike.  


Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't ride, you could meet us at one of the checkpoints with water and cliff bars. (I like the peanut toffee crunch flavor) 

Make some noise!   Blow up all your social media accounts and share this with your circles! 
If you are an artist, and might be interested in mentoring, please contact me at camp.lindsaymanolakos@gmail.com

If you are a business and might be interested in being a sponsor for our fall benefit concert, please email me.

story:
The project

The graphic novel "The First Steps" is a graphic novel created by the artist Nuka K. Godtfredsen is corporation with the National Museum of Denmark and the school book publisher Ilinniusiorfik. The purpose of the project is to disseminate the archeological and historical facts to a broader audience, and as Nuka draws very detailed drawings catching the colors of the Arctic nature, his art is perfect in combination with the archeology.

The First Steps is about the first migrations to Greenland from Canada. This is the story: "It is 4500 years ago. We are in northernmost Canada and Greenland. Following a vendetta a small group of people are leaving their familiar world behind to migrate into unknown areas in the east. But the sea ice is brittle and the hunting unsuccesful so they do not make it. Only the boy Nanu and a few others survive. Nanu cannot forget the new hunting grounds, and when he grows up and becomes a big hunter, he and his family once more travel to the east - and into Greenland. Here they explore the northernmost parts of the World, they hunt musk ox and settle down. The circle is complete when Nanu and his group of Independence hunters, who migrated to the northward of Greenland, meet the first people, who went to the southward of the country, the Saqqaq people. 

In September Nuka is showing some of his boards and books in Osaka, Japan, and then in December his exhibition "Qanga" (http://natmus.dk/en/salg-og-ydelser/museumsfaglige-ydelser/vandreudstillinger/qanga-tegnet-fortid) is going to Tokyo, Japan. "Qanga" consists of 25 of the water color paintings from the two first books about Greenlandic prehistory. The Japanse publisher http://www.shimizukobundo.com has agreed to publish the first (and second) book, and the Hans Lynge Foundation has agreed to pay the translation fees for the first book. 

The video shows Nuka drawing and painting one page from the second book "The Ermine" (about the Dorset people and shamanism) which as "The First Steps" is a combination of art, science and education.


We need you to help us the rest of the way

All amounts paid to this project will help us! You can pay as little or as much as you want...

The 16.500 USD is going to pay the printing and dtp (graphic) fees for the first book. The text is translated to Japanese - this will be paid by The Hans Lynge Foundation.

This will be a huge chance for Nuka and for Greenland as well to show the former Inuit way of living in fantastic water color paintings made by a modern artist.

Risks & Challenges

Our time to do this is very narrow. We have asked around for foundations and companies to sponsor this project, but we end up in a limbo between culture, education, business and and unusual corporation, that people are not used to (a Greenlandic/Japanese/Danish cultural corporation). So, we are now doing a last effort to get the money to make this dream come true! 


【グリーンランドの先史時代を描いたグラフィックノベル、”The First Steps”　日本語訳出版へ向けてクラウドファンディングにご協力をお願いします！】

”The First Steps” は、グリーンランド人であるヌカK. ゴットフレッセン氏が、デンマーク国立博物館と共同で執筆したグラフィックノベル。考古学的、歴史的な側面からグリーンランドを紹介するために描かれた作品です。ゴットフレッセン氏による細やかな作画によって、北極の美しい景色が鮮やかに描かれています。

今年９月に、ゴットフレッセン氏の作品は、大阪の国立民族学博物館にて展示されます。また東京でも「Qanga先史時代を描くということ（仮題）」というテーマで、グリーンランドの先史時代を描いた２冊の作品から、水彩画25作品が展示されます。上の動画では、ゴットフレッセン氏の制作現場をご覧いただけます。〔Qangaについては以下をご覧ください　http://natmus.dk/en/salg-og-ydelser/museumsfagl...

日本で作品を発表する機会に際し、私たちはぜひゴットフレッセン氏のグラフィックノベル２作品を日本語でも出版したいと考えています。

グリーンランドの先史時代を描いたグラフィックノベル”The First Steps” は、現在、日本語訳出版のためのクラウドファンディングを実施しています。

出版には16.500ドルの費用がかかります。これまで多くの企業やファンドに問い合わせしてまいりましたが、時間的に余裕がないこともあり、出版に必要な費用がまだ足りません。出版は（株）清水弘文堂書房様による出版が決定しています。

日本ではまだほとんど知られていないグリーンランド、イヌイットの歴史や生活文化を、美しい水彩画で日本の皆さまにお伝えできる数少ない作品のひとつです。少しでもご支援いただき、皆さまと共に出版することができましたら、とても嬉しく思います。

どうぞよろしくお願いいたします。


【本のあらすじ】

The First Stepsは、カナダからグリーンランドに初めてやって来たイヌイットについての話。時は4500年前に遡ります。当時カナダの北部に暮らしていたイヌイットの家族は、住み慣れた土地を離れ、東へ向けて旅立ちます。しかし海氷は壊れやすく不安定で、狩りにも難航した彼らは、一旦その旅を諦めます。子どもの頃にその旅を経験した少年、ナヌはその旅のことが忘れられず、成長し大人になった今、再びその地へ向けて、東へ―グリーンランドへ―旅立つのです。世界の最も北へ旅立った彼らは、その新しい土地で、様々な動物や新たな人々との出会いを経験します。


【入金方法】

クレジットカードでのご入金のみになります。

１）HP右側のContribute Nowをクリックしてください。

２）新しいページに、金額をご入力いただき、お名前のご表示を希望されない方は、金額欄の下の小さな四角にチェックを入れてください。個人でご寄附いただく場合は、No Perkとし、その後にContinue to paymentをクリック

３）クレジットカード情報（名義、番号、カード裏3ケタのセキュリティ番号、有効期限）と、ご住所をご入力の上、Contributeをクリック

４）確認画面が表示されます。

story:
The basics

Delivering the best, affordable video, audio, and text based training for professionals to create the most optimal and accessible digital experiences for people with disabilities on the web, on devices, in apps, in schools and work places. Also delivering the best, affordable training for individuals with disabilities and trainers on using assistive technologies.

The U.N. estimates that there are more than 1 billion people with disabilities living in this world today. With their billions of dollars in marketing power, it’s important to reach them by making your digital experiences fully accessible. No matter whether you are a project manager, a designer, a developer, a consultant, a marketing or an hr. professional, knowing what you can do to enhance the experiences you can offer can only lead to a better world for all.

There are many resources on the web where you can read about accessibility; but those resources are scattered, requiring you to search through numerous irrelevant or outdated documents. Or you could hire expensive consultants to teach you or your company. You can avoid the frustrating search for learning material while finding affordable options to gain the knowledge you need. Why not keep up with increasing legal and regulatory requirements to make digital experiences accessible and include people with disabilities in the new digital world at an affordable price? Find all the learning resources you need without having to do frustrating searches.

As accessibility consultants, experts, and assistive technology trainers, you can keep up with your knowledge and reuse the course material developed by The Accessibility TV Network in your organization to teach others. you will also find specialized courses to meet your own needs as consultants or trainers.

Or, as individuals with disabilities, you can find courses to train you on how to use your assistive technologies you rely on to be productive and independent.

Accessibility TV (or a11y TV) will create a subscription based training network that will provide you with searchable, relevant, and affordable courses suited to your needs. Delivered via the web or mobile apps, these courses will be designed and presented by industry-leading experts. The Accessibility TV network will make sure that you understand the needs of people with disabilities no matter what job requires you to serve their needs. Or, as individuals with disabilities and trainers, you will have the latest resources you will need to learn to be the most independent you can be.

The funds from this campaign will go to establish the infrastructure for the Accessibility TV network and develop courses when we begin offering the service. The funds will go to pay the high-quality professionals who will provide the best training experience you can find. the more you contribute, the more courses we can have at launch. We have designed the rewards so that you receive the best benefits for your early support.

Who is behind this effort?

EZFire has been delivering consulting services and training to individuals and organizations since 2006. Pratik Patel, EZFire’s Founder and CEO has been involved with assistive technology and accessibility services since 2000. Working at the City University of New York, Pratik provided training to many students with disabilities. Later on, he consulted with the university to make its digital presence fully accessible to its faculty and students with disabilities. Since 2006, Pratik has delivered numerous trainings to clients in industries ranging from entertainment to design, and from governments to nonprofits. EZFire and its team are well equipped with delivering the best experience for you.

Why a crowd funding campaign?

We have several reasons to do a crowd funding campaign:

  • We want to be open about what we're doing and how we're doing it. Crowd funding makes certain that we are open and honest with you, our supporters and future customers. We want to keep you informed of our progress every step of the way. Our challenges, our triumphs, our delights are all things that we believe we should share with you.
  • We certainly believe that there is a large need for a service like this. crowd funding this campaign will help us prove to the world that accessibility matters. It not only matters to us, but it matters to people beyond the little communities that are traditionally associated with people with disabilities.
  • Third, and the most important reason, we want our success to be your success. When we, as individuals join together in a community, it will show that accessibility matters. User experience matters. not only does it matter for someone who has perfect sight or someone who has perfect hearing or someone who has no trouble moving her hands, but accessibility matters for aging grandmothers who need that little extra attention to make sure she can talk to her grandchildren every day.

Visit our subscriptions page to learn more about the plans we plan to offer when The Accessibility TV Network goes live.

In addition to these subscriptions, we plan to further accessibility education by offering free content to the community and many other learning resources at no cost. our goal is not only to have a paid subscription model but also provide general training resources at no cost.

The rewards we offer below are general. But detailed rewards are listed on our rewards page.

story:
IMPORTANT: We might have reached the initial goal of $2,000 , but for these cuties we can for sure do at least $4,000 :) :) :)

Our AfriQuest trip-documentary has been for sure a life changing experience and a very good lesson for us. Every day we feel more and more the need to offer as much as possible to this beautiful continent. Unfortunately, lots of children do not have the same chances as the ones in the Western world, and the lack of education can be easily seen.

Visiting the St George Orthodox Primary School in Kibera, the second biggest slum in Africa, we felt that it is our obligation to gather money from friends around the world and help these beautiful kids that deserve a better future.

This is the reason that we started the Help2Learn fundraising campaign..

But let's say few things about the school first:


ST. GEORGE ORTHODOX PRIMARY SCHOOL

The school is located in Kibera slums of Kianda and Bombolulu, in the church compound [St. George Orthodox church].

The operation of the school started in 1991.  Today, it has a population of 180 pupils from various denominations and ethnic backgrounds and it is a day school. The institution is being run by the Orthodox Archbishopric of Kenya and has a total of 13 workers including the teachers and other subordinate staff.

The buildings in place have been purely been built by the church and other well-wishers. It began with only one class and currently it has three operating classes with a fourth one being under construction. The structures are made out of iron sheets and timber. It consists of an administration office, a kitchen, classes and a hall which was formerly a church.

Most of the pupils are either fully or partially sponsored by the Orthodox Church under the leadership of His Eminence Archbishop Makarios.

It is worthy noting that the services  that the school has offered since it started  have been inspiring and this has made the school to be recognized be very positive among the community in Kibera and its outskirts.

There is need for other buildings/ structures to be put in place, alongside classes such as the fence, a library, school supplies, etc. This challenge having been sorted out, the school will make positive milestones towards achieving its goals. As a result, more and more children will have access to education :)

What We Need & What You Get

We had set as an initial goal the amount of $2,000 just to start going, but now, as there is a lot of potential, we hope to be able to get at least to $4,000 and help with some priorities as:

- New classroom (made of iron sheets) : $1,400

- Furniture (desks, blackboard, etc) : $700

- Library, fully equipped with books : $600

- School supplies (notebooks, pencils, rubbers, etc) : $300

- Playground  and sports equipment : $800

- First aid medical kits and hygienic equipment : $200

For any amount donated, we will reward you for your generosity by sending you a personal ''Thank you'' picture with your name on it from a child of the school!

Talking About Us


The Pappas Post : http://www.pappaspost.com/real-lessons-gratitude-smile-worth-million-dollars/
Lifo : http://www.lifo.gr/team/world/51653
SpoudazwGiannena : http://www.spoudazwgiannena.gr/έμπρακτη-ανθρωπιά-για-την-Αφρική

The Impact

This is actually our second fundraising campaign, and to be honest after our first one a few months ago, we said that there is no way we will do that again, cause there is a lot of work to be done and it is quite stressful.

But after our experience so far in Africa, we are getting really sensitive about the huge problems that people are facing everyday and we don't mind spending some time and energy to make this world better. People must have equal opportunities and most important, the right for education. 

So, let's all together start working towards that goal and make the change we wish to see in the world :)

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Spread the campaign - pick up your phone and call now your grandparents, they always have some money aside :P
    • Any other ideas or recommendations are more than welcome!
    Please use the Indiegogo share tools as well so that more and more people get to know about the Help2Learn project!

    You can find more information about who we are and what we do via:

    • our website, www.dreamtravelive.com
    • our facebook page, www.facebook.com/dreamtravelive
    • our twitter accout, www.twitter.com/dreamtravelive
    Also, feel free to contact us personally via:
    1. email : el.chrysovergis@gmail.com, dorabitsi@gmail.com
    2. facebook : elpis trelokomos, dora bitsi
    3. skype : trelokomos, semouazi

    And that’s all there is to it! 

    Thank you sooooo much beautiful people and don't forget,

    Dream.Travel.Live :)
story_txt:
IMPORTANT: We might have reached the initial goal of $2,000 , but for these cuties we can for sure do at least $4,000 :) :) :)
Our AfriQuest trip-documentary has been for sure a life changing experience and a very good lesson for us. Every day we feel more
and more the need to offer as much as possible to this beautiful continent.
Unfortunately, lots of children do not have the same chances as the ones in the
Western world, and the lack of education can be easily seen. 
Visiting the St George Orthodox Primary School in Kibera, the second biggest slum in Africa, we
felt that it is our obligation to gather money from friends around the world
and help these beautiful kids that deserve a better future.
This is the reason that we started the Help2Learn fundraising campaign..



But let's say few things about the school first:
ST. GEORGE ORTHODOX PRIMARY SCHOOL
The school is located in Kibera slums of Kianda and Bombolulu,
in the church compound [St. George Orthodox church].
The operation of the school started in 1991.  Today, it has a population of 180 pupils from
various denominations and ethnic backgrounds and it is a day school. The
institution is being run by the Orthodox Archbishopric of Kenya and has a total
of 13 workers including the teachers and other subordinate staff.
The
buildings in place have been purely been built by the church and other well-wishers.
It began with only one class and currently it has three operating classes with a fourth one being under construction. The structures are made out of iron sheets and timber.
It consists of an administration office, a kitchen, classes and a hall which
was formerly a church. 



Most of the pupils are either fully or
partially sponsored by the Orthodox Church under the leadership of His Eminence
Archbishop Makarios.
It is worthy noting that the services  that the school has offered since it started  have been inspiring and this has made the
school to be recognized be very positive among the community in Kibera and its
outskirts.
There is need for other buildings/

Spread the campaign - pick up your phone and call now your grandparents, they always have some money aside :P
Any other ideas or recommendations are more than welcome!
Please use the Indiegogo share tools as well so that more and more people get to know about the Help2Learn project!You can find more information about who we are and what we do via:
our website, www.dreamtravelive.com

our facebook page, www.facebook.com/dreamtravelive

our twitter accout, www.twitter.com/dreamtravelive

Also, feel free to contact us personally via:

email : el.chrysovergis@gmail.com, dorabitsi@gmail.com

facebook : elpis trelokomos, dora bitsi

skype : trelokomos, semouazi

story:
My name is Julia Vieau and I am raising $3000 to travel to Mysore India in January 2013 to study ashtanga yoga. I plan to practice yoga at the Sri K. Pattabhi Jois Ashtanga Yoga institute for two months.

I began practicing Ashtanga Yoga with dedication about two years ago. This means that each morning, 5-6 times a week, I rise early and go to the studio to do my practice. Practicing Ashtanga in the mysore style is unique in that each day I do the same series of postures to the rhythm of my own breath. The postures create a stable framework through which I can see myself transform. I continue to become stronger and more flexible in my body and in my life. I want to go to India to deepen my practice by traveling to its place of origin and learning from some of the best ashtanga teachers that exist today.

My experience in India will enrich my experience of yoga as well as inspire my art and my cooking. By supporting my campaing you are investing in me and my future!

 

The $3000 that I am raising goes to cover

  • a plane ticket for $1500
  • $1000 to study at the ashtanga yoga institute for 2 months
  • $500 towards living expenses while I'm there

 

I'm including perks to express my gratitude for your contribution! I deeply appreciate donations of any amount. It means so much to me to have the support of my community.

Please share this campaign with your friends and family! You can tell them in person, email a link, post it on facebook!

I am so grateful! Thank you so much!!

--Julia

Special Thanks to my amazing teachers Vivian and Aeryk and to Riley McLaughlin for filming and editing my video!

story:
WE GOT SKILLZ

UNESCO states that every child has the right to education and the right to play. The goal of this event is to bring both of those basic needs together to create a groundbreaking experience for Ugandan children, thus leaving a lasting impression.

African countries are seen by the West as needing "help" or "charity", but we believe that in Uganda it is more important to build community, create team-work,  foster creativity and reinstate the ability to dream so that the seeds sown are local, organic and sustainable.

WHY SOCCER?

Soccer relies on the above-mentioned elements for success because the total of the team is greater than the sum of its parts... and the youth in Uganda understand soccer (the national sport); both as an escape and distraction, but also a chance to dream, be creative and find common-ground with one-another.

Who am I?

My name is Ben Newman, I recently shelved my fitness business in the hopes of working with an organization doing REAL good in the world. I have experience with professional soccer academies, 10 years in the fitness industry and love teaching so I am excited to be sharing it with such a great cause!

The soccer academy has been running since '96 and Bavubuka Allstarz has been doing good work in Uganda for over 10 years. 

I am blessed with the opportunity to do something "bigger than you and me"; a mantra passed down from a friend who passed away recently.  He talked about doing things out of love, being peaceful/compassionate, being grounded in the foundation of who you are morally and treating the world as your family. He was supposed to be on this trip but passed before making that dream possible.  RIP Randy Ponzio.  

Now at 33 I am energized to share my unique skills and talents on a global scale. So I am going to... with your help!"

That is why this project is so important...

Everyone wants to "save the children" and "give to the poor" .... But East Africans are far from helpless. Often, however they need 'opportunity' in order to thrive.  Rather than "give a man a fish" we're "teaching a man to fish".  I like to think of what we are doing as educating, training and facilitating the opportunity to dream a bigger dream.

70% of uganda's population is under the age of 30, (almost 24 million people.) I turned 33 this year and I cannot begin to know what my childhood, adolescence, teen and young adult years would have been like without the opportunities presented to me here in Canada. Here's to sharing....

Where will your donations go?

There are 4 goals we are hoping to acheive.

1) Fly to Uganda so that we can analyze the programs, facilities, the training and the experience that a child has when they become a part of the Mankindye Soccer Academy.  We believe this is the main reason for going; so that we can offer the coaches and staff more education, up-to-date research on fitness practices and coaching materials to better support the children longterm.

2) "WE GOT SKILLZ" - We wish to develop an annual "creative" tournament so that this endeavor continues to bear fruit annually.  An injection of funds does very little longterm if there is no follow-up.  We want this to be an event that continues to give back for years to come.

3)Resources.  The academy plays host to over 100 children from 6 to 20yrs old. Knowing children you'll know that few things last very long in their hands. Your donations will go to buy new equipment from local businesses in Uganda.

4)Facilities.  This project is being run entirely by donation. Any extra money from this campaign will go into a longterm fund designed to help erect a local sports facility so that work can be done on the ground in Uganda.

Nearly 40% of Ugandans live on less than $1.25/day so most of the help is going to come from generous people such as yourself. Every dollar helps!

YOU GET... 

For every donation we will give you a tax receipt from Bavubuka Foundation Charitable organization, and with each level of donation you get a cooler and cooler prize.  <<See them under Perks of sponsorship.>>

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help if you want to:

Firstly, Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!!

COME!  If you want to share your skills, time and energy with us and the kids... join our team, maybe come to Uganda, or simply help out here in Vancouver.

PLEASE use the Indiegogo share tools, share on FB, Twitter and any other social Media.  Inquire at your church, ask for support from your kids soccer team/association or ask your friends.... Anything helps!

WE APPRECIATE YOU AND YOUR HELP! 

 

Cheers,

The Bavubuka (youth), Ben and Silas

Cheers,

story:
Thank you so much for visting the donation page I set up. All you have to do is click the donate button and give whatever amount of money you feel like. Dollar amounts donated from $5 to $200 can earn perks and prizes.

 Short Summary

Thank you so much for your help so far on my trip. We are on the last step to funding my school trip:

-We need only $670 till this trip is completly funded

-I am adding an extra $50 onto this price due to the fee for fundraising on this site

-I will need the money by April 5th to turn it into my teacher 

The Impact

I believe going on this trip will be great for me it will be a fun and insightful trip:

-I will be able to use my spanish in real life and I believe that this will help me get a much better grasp on the language

-I will be able to see the culture and daily life of those who live in Costa Rica

-I will also get to see the beautiful rain forests and beaches

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides just donating there are other ways that you can help out my trip:

-You can also send your donations in the mail

-I would be glad to earn some money too if you need any work done around the house

-I would be happy to babysit anytime if you need me
