story:
InSB, in short :

Integrated School of Building -InSB- is the first tuition-free Higher Education and accessible Professional Education model in Chicago.

We prepare students to not just perform but thrive in their careers in AEC -Architecture, Engineering, and Construction.

Founded in 2011, InSB is a Not-For-Profit organization in Illinois awaiting 501c3 tax-exempt status from the IRS (applied in July 2012).

WE ARE A NEW AEC+ DESEGREGATED PLATFORM, EDUCATING THE NEXT GROUP OF ARCHITECTS, ENGINEERS, AND BUILDERS THROUGH COLLABORATION AND PRACTICAL MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCES.

"TO FOSTER THE NEXT (BEST) AEC+ GENERATION"

--

What we've done :

Besides our never-ending work in structural development -challenging in being an innovative model- we hosted our 1st Summer Symposium this past June.

InSB Symp 12 successfully brought together more than 40 people, from new undergraduate students in the industry to established leaders.

In 2013 we finally managed to acquire our modest space in downtown Chicago (for easy access) close to the L, and have launched our first micro-course : LEAN in AEC. This micro-course was launched through "Submit a 10", a global InSB course development platform; feature on ArchDaily on Easter Sunday.

ALL MICRO-COURSES ONLINE

You can also view our "year in review" digital publications online :

IN InSB - Vol 1 - 2011 - the founding year in review

IN InSB - Vol 2 - 2012 - a year in review

The 2013 summer symposium is well underway. Scheduled for July. More on Symp 13.

 

In addition, InSB has called its HSAEC 2013 class -Sessions 1 and 2, for June.

HSAEC is a 2-week High School Summer Institute in Architecture, Engineering, and Construction.

Students will learn the basics of architectural design, building systems, construction means and methods, and about sustainability, using this city as your lab, while sharpening your critical thinking, analytical, presentation, and collaboration skills.

More on HSAEC 2013.

--

Why we need you :

For two years, our president and co-founder has exahusted her every penny in setting up and developing the school, but only so much can be done out of a single pocket. 

Read more about her

And though there is an unwavering overwhelming amount of support for the school, from the board, soon-to-be faculty, soon-tobe students, and individuals truly wanting to become partially involved at the "small scale big impact" level, major funding has yet to come by -mostly because of the pending tax exempt status.

Read more about the Executive Board

Read more about the Advisory Board

Also, in order for the school to get its jump-start, our president and co-founder needed to become a full-time employee of the school... eliminating the only economic source of that pocket all together -her last job as CM/Owner Rep in Construction.

--

What we will accomplish with your help :

We simply want to:

a - keep our low-operating-cost space, so we can continue to host small events like the upcoming Chicago Women in Architecture Website Design Workshop, or Women in Construction brainstorming session scheduled for April, and Public Interest Design Studio scheduled to launch in the summer, and other.

b - run our new innovative -desegregated- tuition-free models for undergraduate and graduate education. Read more . . .

UNDERGRADUATE STUDIES

GRADUATE STUDIES

--

The impact of your help, at InSB :

With your help, we will be able to 

a - provide an tuition-free higher ed and accessible advanced professional education to individuals in or looking to enter AEC

b - fix a deeply fractured industry by ammending obsolete notions and practices, with the fostering of a new generation of true collaborators and innovators

c - use our platform to improve diversity and empower people

d - use our platform to give back to the city; an insb education will be hands-on with impact in communities at large... so your impact truly will be expanded in more ways than one

--

Other ways to help us, at InSB :

Tell a friend.

We are looking for all the support we can get, to keep going, and to push this industry -and the people that make it- forward.

story:
Hey there! I'm Jake Bellavance and this is my fundraiser

I'm 18 years old, and am raising money for the next major chapter of my life. This chapter includes an 11 month long trip to New Zealand to volunteer in a school with the organization Lattitude! Just to give you a little more knowledge of myself, I'm a West coast Canadian who was raised on a little island known as Salt Spring and now currently am an undergraduate at Capilano University in Vancouver studying social justice with the hopes of becoming a teacher of english or arts.

Here's a link to the organization! http://www.lattitudecanada.org/

Why am I fundraising and why so little time?

As for what my goal is and why it's so close even though I leave in July, I've found out just how expensive travel is, as my flights are quite expensive. I have to raise enough money for my flights to New Zealand by February or I can't go on the trip at all as I need to confirm my spot. So I have to raise ~$2,000 in  only about 2 months! Even with my mom having paid the ~$3,000 for the rest of the trip. Of course, I shall be looking for a job to help take off some of the pressure of fund raising, but being in school it's definitely hard to raise so much money in such a short period of time! So every donation means the absolute world to me as each dollar brings me closer to my dreams of teaching, traveling and living in New Zealand. If I happen to go over the fundraising goal (which would be miraculous) it would go towards filling my two month break (schools closed for summer break) with fun activities!

Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can't donate any money or if you want to do more, I'm always looking for advice on what other things I need for travelling, what to do in New Zealand, old travel books or even just support!

Thanks for reading about my fundraiser!

and a very special thank you if you choose to donate, every dollar truly helps :)
story_txt:

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Mira. I am 14 years old and I come from a family of four kids.  Last year, my parents had enough money to send my to a gifted and talented camp that changed my life. This year, it is not the same story. It is an expensive camp, but I am willing to do anything it takes. It is a program that you go to for 3 weeks and choose a course to study, and I applied and even got in with my first choice of class. All I'm missing is the money...

What We Need & What You Get

The minimum amount I would raise is $2000 (half of the camp tuition).

I would then be able to spend 3 weeks on a college campus, learning and meeting new people (as well as seeing all of my close friends from last year). 

The Impact

Well, let's put it this way:

My generation is the future of the world. What's more important than educating the future? This camp is without a doubt the best thing that's ever happened to me, and I would do anything to relive it this summer. 

If you are interested, here is a short essay about my experience (written for a high school application): 

 

Out of experiences that I’ve had in my life, the most memorable has been a Duke TIP Summer Studies Program that I attended in June. I qualified for it by taking the SAT and getting a good score. I remember not wanting to go at first, but my parents convinced me that I should. I filled out a roommate questionnaire and sent in my class request form. I later found out that I got my first choice of class (Shakespeare/Acting).

On departure day, I asked myself questions like What if kids in my class are smarter than me? What if my teacher’s mean? What if my roommate doesn’t like me? I got so sad that I broke down in tears; I couldn’t believe I was going away for three weeks. After a plane ride that felt very long, I got to North Carolina. I was greeted by a counselor from the camp and joined a group of kids who were also going to the Davidson College campus, where the camp was being held.

I remember seeing the place for the first time, unaware of how familiar I’d become with it. I got to my room, where my roommate was already unpacking. That night I met my RC group (like a “bunk,” but we lived in different rooms, in the same hallway).  I was super quiet at first, but I quickly became comfortable around them.

During my first class, we introduced ourselves, not knowing that in just a week we’d have more inside jokes than we can count on two hands! Spending 7 hours each day in class, we formed tight bonds and even hung out together during free time. We were known as the “Shakespeareans” and were often heard around campus singing our famous cheers and songs. Our teachers (one main instructor and an assistant) were more laid back and fun than I’d expected. My knowledge of Shakespeare and my acting techniques improved and I had fun learning and performing monologues, dialogues, and scenes with peers.  At the end of each class, our instructor Ryan made a short speech known as his “spiel.” Sometimes it’d be funny, sometimes it’d teach us a life lesson, but it always left us with something to think about.

In a short time, I was friends with my RC group, my class, and even people who I’d met in the dining hall, at evening activities, or through other friends.  I was closer to my new friends than I was to most people at home that I’d known for years. I could tell them anything and I wasn’t afraid to be myself completely. For the first time in a long time, I was in an environment where everybody had their own interests, thinking processes, and favorite things. They came from different backgrounds and were intelligent and unique. There was no peer pressure and no desire to be like anyone else.  But most importantly, everyone was excepted. Nobody was made fun of or afraid to be themselves. Sure, we all had our closest group of friends, but we were a big family- I was never alone.

The routine of each day became like second nature, and my love for the place and people grew more all the time. As we neared the last week of camp, I realized that I’d be home soon. We got our end-of-term shirts, went to our last Friday night dance, and received our termbooks (like a yearbook, with everyone’s RC group and class pages). During our last class, Ryan made his final spiel about living for the moment. While we all got emotional, he talked to us about how memories can never be relived. “Even if we meet here again next year,” he said, “and I teach you the exact same things, it won’t be the same. You need to cherish every experience and every moment that you get, because that is the first and last one of its kind.” He told us how much he’d miss us, and how we’d been a  pleasure to teach. In tears, we said our final goodbyes to him and that concluded our last class.

The next day, I was leaving early in the morning, so I wouldn’t have the chance to say goodbye to friends. But to my surprise, I heard  knocks on my door at 6:30am. I opened up, and there stood my RC group and a few friends from class. Most of them were in tears like I was. I couldn’t believe that they’d woken up so early to say bye to me. I hugged each of them as long as I could before I had to go downstairs and sign out. In disbelief that it was over, I recalled the day I walked into the same building for the first time. I didn’t want leave.

At Duke TIP, I learned more than I thought I would, and had more fun than I thought I could. Not only had my knowledge and acting developed, but I gained things that I can take with me wherever I go. I learned  to make new friends, how to form bonds with my teachers, and even how to play a few new sports. Most importantly, however, I learned what it feels like to be accepted and loved by a group of people in which everyone is a unique personality, and how to live every moment to the fullest. Leaving TIP was even more emotional than leaving home, and I want to go back in future summers. I found lifelong friends, had unforgettable experiences, and realized what it’s like to be myself- these are things that can’t be taught, but Duke TIP found a way…

story:
The project (italiano sotto) 

House of Dreaming

We had text prepared for this fundraiser. In light of the events of the past few weeks we are revisiting that text. What can we say? We mourn all the unnecessary loss of life. We mourn the children who will never get to grow up or who will grow up without a mother or father. We mourn the children who are being traumatized and terrorized on a daily basis.  We try to feel hopeful for the future of the children and the people of the land. And we feel the strong need for grassroots projects that give children the space to be kids and to be heard.

It has been a difficult few weeks and a difficult year for everyone and particularly difficult for the children of the West Bank, given the political situation in the region. Bethany (Al-Elzariya) is a town in the West Bank cut off from East Jerusalem by a separation wall. Disputes over land and other social problems also threaten the village’s social fabric. (For more information on Bethany see link at the bottom.)

In June 2019 we raised funds for a 10-day summer camp in Beit Jala (West Bank). The camp was such a huge success that we decided to try again. This summer we will bring together 30 children from the Beit Jala and Bethany area for one month. Our aim is to create a safe and creative environment for the children to play and heal.  Using the methods of non-violent communication (NVC), we remind children of their basic communication tools focusing on feelings and needs, self-expression and finding healthy strategies to meet those needs, teaching life skills for reaching across differences, resolving conflicts, and building long-lasting, meaningful connections. There will be a strong focus on contact with nature, which we believe is crucial to healthy development and mental health. We will also focus on community building by involving mothers and even grandmothers in some of our activities, which we hope will help build stronger connections with each other and with their children/grandchildren.


Activities include: camping, nature walks, cooking, pottery, theatre, planting, art, movement, well-being/NVC activities
The children will be provided with a healthy, fresh meal and snack every day. Some meals will be provided by the project and some will be prepared by parents as a way for them to contribute and feel connected to the project.

Program start date : c. 28 June 2021

Duration : 1 month

Who : 30 children aged 9-16 (from Al-Eizariya, SOS village Palestine, Dheisheh camp, Enad theatre) The older kids will start to build skills as youth leaders and help to look after the younger kids. Children from different communities will be brought together

Staff : Psychologist, social worker, expert in building youth programs, NVC facilitator. Staff will meet for a half hour debriefing at the end of each day (what went well/what didn’t go well arising issues, children who may need more guidance/attention)

Budget:  Approximately 13,200 euros for 30 children. Approximately 400/child for the full period or 100/week/child

To be added to our mailing list for updates on our projects email us: dreamitwillit@gmail.com

Al-Elzariya: https://pij.org/articles/1584/aleizariya-bethan...

Italiano 

Il progetto: House of Dreaming

Avevamo preparato un testo per questa raccolta fondi. Alla luce degli eventi della scorsa settimana, stiamo rivisitando quel testo. Cosa possiamo dire? Piangiamo tutte le inutili perdite di vite umane. Piangiamo i bambini che non cresceranno mai o che cresceranno senza una madre o un padre. Piangiamo i bambini che vengono traumatizzati e terrorizzati ogni giorno. Cerchiamo di contnuare di sperare nel futuro dei bambini e della gente del paese

Sono state settimane difficili e un anno difficile per tutti e particolarmente difficile per i bambini della Cisgiordania, vista la situazione politica nella regione. Bethany (Al-Elzariya) è una città della Cisgiordania isolata da Gerusalemme Est da un muro di separazione. Conflitto sulla terra e altri problemi sociali minacciano il tessuto sociale del paese. (Per ulteriori informazioni su Bethany vedere il link in fondo.)

Nel giugno 2019 abbiamo raccolto fondi per un campo estivo di 10 giorni a Beit Jala (Cisgiordania). Il campo è stato un così grande successo che abbiamo deciso di riprovare. Quest'estate riuniremo per un mese 30 bambini di diversi background della zona di Beit Jala e Betania. Il nostro obiettivo è creare un ambiente sicuro e creativo in cui i bambini possano giocare e guarire. Utilizzando i metodi della comunicazione non violenta (CNV), ricordiamo ai bambini i loro strumenti di comunicazione di base concentrandosi sui sentimenti e sui bisogni, sull'espressione di sé e sulla ricerca di strategie sane per soddisfare tali bisogni, insegnando le abilità di vita per superare le differenze, risolvere i conflitti e costruire connessioni significative e durature. Ci sarà una forte attenzione al contatto con la natura, che riteniamo fondamentale per uno sviluppo sano e per la salute mentale. Ci concentreremo anche sulla costruzione della comunità coinvolgendo madri e persino nonne in alcune delle nostre attività, che speriamo contribuiranno a costruire legami più forti tra loro e con i loro figli / nipoti

Le attività includono: campeggio, passeggiate nella natura, cucina, ceramiche, teatro, piantagione, arte, movimento, benessere / attività CNV

Ai bambini verrà fornito ogni giorno un pasto sano e fresco e uno spuntino. Alcuni pasti saranno forniti dal progetto e alcuni saranno preparati dai genitori come un modo per loro di contribuire e sentirsi connessi al progetto

Data di inizio del programma: c. 28 giugno 2021

Durata: 1 mese

Chi: 30 bambini di età compresa tra 9 e 16 anni (da Al-Eizariya, SOS Village Palestine, Dheisheh camp, Enad theatre) I ragazzi più grandi inizieranno a sviluppare abilità come punti di riferimento nei confronti dei più piccoli e aiuteranno a prendersi cura di questi ultimi.. I bambini delle comunità musulmane / cristiane saranno riuniti

Personale: psicologo, assistente sociale, esperto nella costruzione di programmi per i giovani, facilitatore CNV. Il personale si incontrerà per un debriefing di mezz'ora alla fine di ogni giornata (cosa è andato bene / cosa non è andato bene/ problemi derivanti, bambini che potrebbero aver bisogno di maggiore guida / attenzione)

Al-Elzariya: https://pij.org/articles/1584/aleizariya-bethan...

Per essere aggiunto alla nostra mailing list per aggiornamenti sui nostri progetti scrivici:

dreamitwillit@gmail.com

story:
Welcome to the AMYLA St. Thomas Expedition Campaign!


The Adams Morgan Youth Leadership Academy (AMYLA) was founded in 2008 to fill the gap we observed for a much-needed community program that was geared towards interacting and collaborating with the local youth population in the Washington DC neighborhoods of Adams Morgan and Columbia Heights; more specifically those who are living in low income housing and may not have access to other programs. AMYLA  primarily acts as a after school center and youth enrichment hub, focused on working with adolescents and young adults between the ages of 13 and 21.

AMYLA  provides these youth with events and services such as community service initiatives that create more positive social infrastructures in their neighborhoods and sponsorship programs that bring in internships, mentorships, and career training seminars to provide them access to resources and guidance that lays the foundation for that skill set that ensures professional and personal success!

With your help, this July we will send 12- 15 AMYLA youths, most of whom have never left the country, and four of our staff members on a five day cultural expedition to St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands! Even though St. Thomas is a territory of the United States, the island has always maintained an individually rich culture; unique in  languages, food, history, and music among many other aspects! While on the island, AMYLA will collaborate with the Lybia's Daughter Organization to facilitate visits to historic sites such as forts and sugar plantations, travel to the mountains and agricultural zones of the island, take a day trip to the island of St. John, participate in bonding/team-building exercises, visit an underwater aquarium, meet with government officials, and much much more. With the success of this campaign this will be the sixth time that AMYLA has had the pleasure of sending youth abroad. We want to keep our momentum going and make this the best trip yet, so any and all support puts us that much closer to our goal!


What We Need 

The full amount that AMYLA needs for the summer expedition is $15,000. We have been able to raise $5,000 towards the trip, so the purpose of this campaign is to raise the remaining 2/3 we need to make it a reality! : $10,000 

Here is a quick overview of what will be included in the budget:                                     
  • Roundtrip plane tickets for the girls and staff                                                                          
  • Room and Board for 5 days and 4 nights                                                                                   
  • Costs of food and transportation                                                                                                 
  • Reservations for tours, events, and a team-building retreat
We are asking for donations of $30 or more so that we can reach our goal by May 5th, giving us ample time to book flights and secure reservations before our tentative departure. ALL FUNDS will be transferred directly into the AMYLA Expedition account,created for the sole purpose of holding all donations for this trip, so every cent counts!
If we are unable to raise these funds the entire trip will be in jeopardy of not happening, but with your help we know that success is our only possible outcome!


The Impact

Out of the many endeavors that AMYLA  takes on to benefit the youth of Washington DC, our AMYLA Expedition program is by far one of the most crucial! We  believe the opportunity for young adults and adolescents to travel abroad is an invaluable milestone that broadens their horizons and cultivates a cultural receptiveness in those important formative years.

        As it stands, AMYLA has excellent track record with these cultural emersion       programs abroad. Previous groups over the past six years have travelled across the United States and to countries such as Guatemala, Haiti, Trinidad, and Israel. These expeditions have given the youth a chance to see themselves as a part of the global community and not limited by the imaginary boundaries that often may hold them back from unlocking their full potential. 

                                  

We have made it our duty to do everything in our power to give these youth the opportunities that they may have not had access to otherwise. After all, it only takes one life-changing experience in an individual's life to put them on the path to becoming the next leader of the future!


The Obstacle

Like most non-profit organizations the dual saving grace and biggest obstacle for AMYLA is funding. Without it, all of the amazing ideas and programs that we create are unable to function properly or not at all. This trip is no different; to provide these girls with this amazing opportunity requires the support of friends, family, and the community as a whole.  But we have no doubt that we are all up to the challenge!


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that it is tax season, that  people may have other financial obligations, and that a creepingly slow rise in employment opportunities have made funds tight all around. 

If you're unable able to contribute funds, please help the campaign by sending the short link to this page (http://igg.me/at/StThomasAMYLA) to 5-10 people. That would be a tremendous help!

We are happy to answer any questions about this campaign! Thank you in advance for your support, both personally and in spirit!

Best Regards,

Adams Morgan Youth Leadership Academy
story_txt:
Welcome to the AMYLA St. Thomas Expedition Campaign!

The Adams Morgan Youth Leadership Academy (AMYLA) was founded in 2008 to fill the gap we observed for a much-needed community program that was geared towards interacting and collaborating with the local youth population in the Washington DC neighborhoods of Adams Morgan and Columbia Heights; more specifically those who are living in low income housing and may not have access to other programs. AMYLA  primarily acts as a after school center and youth enrichment hub, focused on working with adolescents and young adults between the ages of 13 and 21.
AMYLA  provides these youth with events and services such as community service initiatives that create more positive social infrastructures in their neighborhoods and sponsorship programs that bring in internships, mentorships, and career training seminars to provide them access to resources and guidance that lays the foundation for that skill set that ensures professional and personal success!
With your help, this July we will send 12- 15 AMYLA youths, most of whom have never left the country, and four of our staff members on a five day cultural expedition to St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands! Even though St. Thomas is a territory of the United States, the island has always maintained an individually rich culture; unique in  languages, food, history, and music among many other aspects! While on the island, AMYLA will collaborate with the Lybia's Daughter Organization to facilitate visits to historic sites such as forts and sugar plantations, travel to the mountains and agricultural zones of the island, take a day trip to the island of St. John, participate in bonding/team-building exercises, visit an underwater aquarium, meet with government officials, and much much more. With the success of this campaign this will be the sixth time that AMYLA has had the pleasure of sending youth abroad. We want to keep our momentum going and make this the best trip yet, so any and all support puts us that much closer to our goal!   
What We Need

Reservations for tours, events, and a team-building retreat


We are asking for donations of $30 or more so that we can reach our goal by May 5th, giving us ample time to book flights and secure reservations before our tentative departure. ALL FUNDS will be transferred directly into the AMYLA Expedition account,created for the sole purpose of holding all donations for this trip, so every cent counts!

The Obstacle Like most non-profit organizations the dual saving grace and biggest obstacle for AMYLA is funding. Without it, all of the amazing ideas and programs that we create are unable to function properly or not at all. This trip is no different; to provide these girls with this amazing opportunity requires the support of friends, family, and the community as a whole.  But we have no doubt that we are all up to the challenge!

story:
HELP OUR JUNIOR MARINES!

For the last 10 years, the Bedichek Middle School Junior Marine Corps in Austin, TX has given young men and women opportunities to excel and grow in a structured, leadership-based program.  The 6-8 graders who participate as cadets leave middle school prepared to excel at all their endeavors because of the skills they learned as Junior Marine Cadets!  

The drill team is the pinnacle of excellence and the most highly visible unit with the Corps.  These cadets practice for HUNDREDS of hours in preparation for their competitions!  They truly live the corps motto of ADVERSUS EXITUS OPTIO NON EST: Failure is NOT an option!

What We Need!

After many years of success at the Middle School Drill Team Nationals, the Bedichek Junior Marines have set their sites on the unthinkable: taking a team of 6-8 grade students to compete at the ultimate level at the National HIGH SCHOOL Drill Team Championships.  The Junior Marines consistently compete with - and best - high school units in their area because of their work ethic and commitment!  We need YOUR help to bring them to drill team's ultimate stage: The National High School Drill Team Championships in Daytona Beach, Florida!

  • The Junior Marine Corps program is NOT government or DoD funded; 100% of funds are generated and raised through the school!
  • Travel and lodging costs for a trip of this caliber are astronomical!
  • Cadets furnish their own uniforms but your donation will help offset equipment costs, too!

The Impact!

Bedichek Middle School lies in an economically diverse area of Austin, TX.  Many of our students only leave the confines of their neighborhoods on drill team trips to nearby San Antonio.  To bring these cadets across state lines to the pinnacle of national excellence will:

  • Provide a life-changing experience for a 6-8 grade student!
  • Help further instill that hard work, leadership, and character DO pay off!
  • Bring recognition to a program doing amazing things within its community and help ensure the sustained success of the Junior Marines program for years to come!

You Can Help!

Your donation of ANY amount helps get our Junior Marines down the road!  

  • Please help us spread the word via social media!  Share our campaign with your loved ones, friends, and co-workers!  Let them know the amazing things these Junior Marine Corps Cadets are doing!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
My name is Mason. I am 9 years old and currently in grade 4 in a german bilingual program. I take my education seriously. I work hard and get excellent grades. I plan to become a scientist and hope to create alternative energy sources. The projected average costs of a 4 year university program with residence for my year of admission to studies (2022) is $94,980.

I plan to continue to work hard and will hopefully get a scholarship or two. I am currently working toward becoming a lifeguard which will help with costs. I am hoping for assistance with saving up. Can you help?

story:
#30Days of ThanksgivingLO 

You may not know this about me, but I had the AMAZING opportunity to go through a program called Legal Outreach in high school. Legal Outreach works with students from underserved neighborhoods around NYC and prepares them to succeed in high school, college, and beyond.  

I'm fundraising this November to make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach. 

My Story  

My name is Shakiva Wade and I grew up in the Bronx. I went to Frederick Douglass Academy for high school. 

With LO's help, I went to Brandeis University as a Posse Scholar. 

Because of Legal Outreach, I was encouraged to apply for Posse and went to Brandeis on a full-tuition scholarship. LO sparked my interest in the law beginning with the Mock Trial back in 8th grade. I was inspired to go to law school and I am now an attorney. 

I am currently the Community Law and Education Coordinator at Legal Outreach, and I am grateful to start my legal career at the place that gave me my start. I hope to pursue a career in education law and children's rights in the future. 

Your support can change the lives of more students like me!

Your Support Will... 

Make it possible for more students like me to go through Legal Outreach for four years of free programming, including a debate program, SAT prep, writing classes, mentoring, college application workshops, and much more! 

Of the students LO supports: 

  • 100% graduated HS on time (only 66% of NYC public school students do) 
  • 99% went on to colleges and universities 

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Donate to my campaign before December 2nd, 2014 
  • Share my campaign on social media 
  • Encourage your networks to support my campaign 

I'm thankful for LO and I'm thankful for your support! 

Pictured above: Legal Outreach Class of 2003 (I'm in the light blue shirt!) 
#30DaysofThanksgivingLO 
www.legaloutreach.org
www.facebook.com/legaloutreach 
@legaloutreach

Short Summary

  • My name is Alex, and i have just recently graduated from Regent University. because the job market is so bad right now, finding jobs aren't so easy.  i am currently seeking a commission in the United States Marine Corps as an officer, but in the meantime i am still looking for full time work and the job search isnt going so well
  • i am seeking any funds to help me pay off my school debt. if anyone can find it in their heart to help a follower of Christ out, they would be forever in my prayers.
  • contributers will not only help me pay off debt, they will be helping me to secure the future for my potential family as well. God Bless

story:
**english version follows**

12 Morts lors de l´attaque à Charlie Hebdo le 07 Janvier 2015 dans la capitale française et tous les médias, les français et le monde entier ont montré leur solidarité et leur compassion avec le slogan lancé "Je suis Charlie". 

147 Morts d´étudiants à l’université de Garissa au Kenya le 02 Avril dernier, un acte horrible qui reste malheureusement sous-médiatisé et marqué par une absence de solidarité internationale. 

"On est jamais mieux servi que par soi-même" 

Nous invitons la communauté internationale et en particulier la diaspora africaine à se mobiliser pour venir en aide aux familles endeuillées suite à l´attaque perpétrée à l’université de Garissa, Kenya le 02 Avril dernier. 

Il est temps d’œuvrer pour l’unité, la paix et la solidarité en Afrique. 

Nous appelleonstous les africains et tous les partisans pour la paix et l’unité en Afrique à se joindre à cette initiative en y apportant leur contribution. Partageons le deuil de ces familles éprouvées.

Parlez-en autour de vous en utilisant les réseaux sociaux, le bouche à oreille et aussi les outils de partage Indiegogo. L’Afrique mérite mieux.

**********

12 victims from the Charlie Hedbo attack on January 7, 2015 and the media, the French people and the world showed solidarity and compassion for the victims and their families by launching the slogan “I am Charlie”

147 young victims, all students from the University of Garissa attack on April 2, 2015, a horrible act but sadly no significant media coverage and international solidarity.

“Are these young Africans not worth the same compassion?”

By launching this fund raising campaign, we invite the international community and especially the African diaspora to unite and support the family of the victims of the attack.

It’s time to show that we care for our brothers and sisters.

Make a donation, spread the word using social media and other means. Africa deserves better.

**********

Nous sommes des jeunes africains de la diaspora originaires du Cameroun.  Nous soutenons l´idée d´une Afrique unie. Seuls nous n´y arriverons pas. Nous avons besoin de vous, de vos contributions. C´est une première marque de solidarité africaine et celle-ci a un début : WeCareGarissa, Kenya. 

We are a group of young africans from Cameroon who believe in the premise that Africa must unite and care. We need all your support through your contributions. WeCareGarissa, Kenya is the first initiative to show our solidarity to people in Africa when tragedy hits.

story:
I am raising money to help cover the cost of traveling to a remote area in Costa Rica to provide missionary aid. I have a passion for humanitarian work! However, a majority of the time that passion costs money to cover travel costs.

I am asking for a donation to help me reach my goal so that I am able to travel with others who share my passion to serve and be a compassionate servant while experiencing a humbling encounter!!

While we are down there we will be doing things from digging trenches and latrines for the locals, to excavating places for the locals to play sports and come together in community! We are not staying in what most people would call a "vacation" area. We stay on a native reserve of land, where most of the people are poor, and have next to nothing. There are real dangers in the area we are staying! But as a combat Veteran of Afghanistan, and as a Disciple of Jesus Christ, I believe in going to where the needs are, and meeting them. It isn't always safe, But, God never said he's safe..However he IS good! thank you for your time and your donation. Know that it will go to meet practical needs and tangible goals!

story:
Welcome to Project BDX.

Your mission, if you choose to accept it, is to help me take my place amongst the lucky 100 of 9,000 applicants to live the dream and take the path less travelled. 

I have been chosen, after the hard rounds of submission essays, and 3am Skype interviews, to complete a Masters of Wine Marketing at the Bordeaux International Wine Institute (http://www.wine-institute.com)

The only thing that now stands in my way is tuition fees.

 

A deal's a deal

So where exactly will your donation be going? 

Your generousity will be directly ensuring I can pay my tuition. The cost of a dream- $16,000. In the event of not reaching the full total, you'll still be doing your bit to help fly the kite as high as possible.  

In return, I will share the journey with you; the triumphs, the trials, the education, the tastings, the experience, the language, the people. Everything. The moments that I'm stopped in my tracks thinking just how lucky I am to have been given this opportunity. 

 

Why wine, why Bordeaux? 

There are so many elements that must come together harmoniously to produce a bottle of wine. From hospitable soils, to agreeable weather, timely picking, crushing discerning winemaking, bottling and labeling- finally a finished product is born.

The blood, sweat and tears of a winemaker have gone into a bottle that could then sit in a bottle shop alongside hundreds more, waiting to be plucked out of the line up from a thirsty consumer. What will set this wine apart, however, is the story it tells. Great wines tell a story, and there are so many that have yet to be told.

The endless bonding hours spent by a vintage team produce legendary tales of hilarious misfortune, mischievousness and dumb luck- many of which have shaped iconic wines and their brands. My pursuit is to build great brands and create a sense of personal connection between winery and consumer.

Given Australia’s geographical location, I feel I lack exposure to the expansive European markets that consistently dominate wine production and import/export markets each year.  Therefore, my historical, contextual and product knowledge of these markets does not currently rival our European counterparts.

Australian wine marketers simply do not exist in significant enough numbers to allow for future peer learning or an in-depth understanding of the international wine marketing industry. This course would allow me to establish and learn from a network of globally placed wine communicators, furthering collaborative relationships between industries. 

Help comes in many forms

There are so many different ways to help. Most importantly, make some noise! Spread the word far and wide, yell it from the rooftops, share it on the socials, scribble it on the back of toilet doors.

Every little bit counts. Give me wings and let me fly.

The endless bonding hours spent by a vintage team produce legendary tales of hilarious misfortune, mischievousness and dumb luck- many of which have shaped iconic wines and their brands. My pursuit is to build great brands and create a sense of personal connection between winery and consumer.
Given Australia’s geographical location, I feel I lack exposure to the expansive European markets that consistently dominate wine production and import/export markets each year.  Therefore, my historical, contextual and product knowledge of these markets does not currently rival our European counterparts.
Australian wine marketers simply do not exist in significant enough numbers to allow for future peer learning or an in-depth understanding of the international wine marketing industry. This course would allow me to establish and learn from a network of globally placed wine communicators, furthering collaborative relationships between industries. 
Help comes in many forms
There are so many different ways to help. Most importantly, make some noise! Spread the word far and wide, yell it from the rooftops, share it on the socials, scribble it on the back of toilet doors.
Every little bit counts. Give me wings and let me fly.

story:
Click here for Hi-res Version of this Render

PI2MEDIA HT1 is a fully integrated Media Player and Streamer featuring High Resolution 7.1 Surround Sound.  Key features of the PI2MEDIA HT1 are: 


  • Connects to your TV or Monitor via standard HDMI cable.

  • Internal mSATA storage up to 1TB (comes standard with 32, 250 or 500GB).

  • Comes pre-configured with OSMC® as the default boot option. (This can be changed at any time via the included 8GB SD card loaded with NOOBS.)

  • Outputs 24-Bit 96Khz/192Khz High Resolution Audio on all 8-channels

  • 5.1 pass through via Optical TOSLink (S/PDIF)

  • Direct I2S Bus Connector for Downstream digital Inputs

  • Optional Integrated 40W/Channel Class-D Amplifier

  • Built-in WiFi (802.11b/g/n) with an internal antenna. (Save those USB ports!)

  • WiFi streaming to tablets and phones via UPNP/DLNA protocol

  • Built-in Consumer IR Receiver

  • Three USB ports from the Raspberry Pi® 2 Model B for connecting extra devices (one is used to connect to the 502SSD)

  • Two additional USB ports provide up to 1.5A current for device charging, such as smartphones, digital cameras, tablets, etc

  • Compatible with any powered PC speakers or analog amplifier

  • Completely hackable!  Can be reprogrammed to run any RPi 2 supported OS.

  • Enclosure is machined from T6061 Aircraft Grade aluminum, with hardened, scratch resistant infrared acrylic front panel

  • Completely "silent" operation.  No spinning hard drives to intrude upon your media experience!

  • Compact Size,  (W) 88.35mm x (H) 68.8mm x (D) 98.18mm (110.4mm w/AMP)




At the core of the PI2MEDIA HT1 is the high performance quad core Raspberry Pi® 2 Model B. Running industry standard Open Source Media Center (OSMC) out of the box, the Pi2Media HT1 can also boot all Raspberry Pi supported Operating Systems.

  • A 900MHz quad-core ARM Cortex-A7 CPU

  • VideoCore IV 3D graphics core

  • 1GB RAM

  • Four USB ports (One is used to connect to 502SSD)

  • 100Mbit Ethernet port

  • Micro SD card slot 



The 502SSD Shield provides a number of critical functions needed to form a complete digital computer system.  These include:

  • Two USB 2.0 ports for additional expansion, these provide 1.5A power

  • mSATA Socket for up to 1TB on-board storage

  • GWF-3M08 WiFi Module (Based on Ralink RT5370) provides 802.11b/g/n for up to 150Mbps. On-Module IPEX connector  for optimal antenna placement.

  • DS1339 Real Time Clock with 16mm Coin Cell Battery Backup

  • 1-Wire DS18B20 Temperature Sensor mounted below the SSD

  • DS18B20 also has a unique 64-Bit ID that can be used to identify the shield. 

  • On-Board 5V @ 10A power supply powers the entire system



The 502V2S Shield is used to extract  the 7.1 Surround Sound from the RPi 2 HDMI stream.


  • ADV7623 HDMI 1.4 Transceiver takes the RPi 2 HDMI output and passes it through while extracting the 8-Channels of 24-Bit, 96Khz/192Khz audio.

  • Digital Audio - 24-bit, 96Khz/192Khz 5.1 Compressed Digital Stream (Dolby Digital AC3 and DTS 5.1) via Optical TOSLink (S/PDIF) connector.

  • 16-Pin Header provides access to the I2S bus along with I2C and control.  This will be used to connect to a downstream 40W/Channel Class-D 7.1 Amplifier currently under development.

  • High Resolution Analog Audio - 24-Bit, 96Khz/192Khz Analog Audio Out using four PCM5102A DACs via 3.5mm Jack. Each DAC has its own low noise power supply.  Overall performance exceeds 116db THD + N!


We are pleased to announce a new perk for the PI2MEDIA Home Theater One!

We have designed and developed a powerful, Class-D Surround Sound Amplifier for the HT1.  Based on the TI TAS5548 96KHz PWM Modulator with integrated ASRC and Audio Processor, this amplifier provides full 40W/Channel to 4/8/16 Ohm Speakers using Four TI TAS5342LA Stereo Digital amplifier Power Stages.

This amplifier integrates seamlessly into the HT1 as shown below:

PI2MEDIA HT1-AMP Left Side 3D Render

PI2MEDIA HT1-AMP Right Side 3D Render

PI2MEDIA HT1-AMP Interior Top 3D Render


TAS5548 Key Features:

  • 8ch Asynchronous Sample Rate Converter
  • 8 Channel Audio Processing for 32-192 kHz (ARSC to 96kHz)
  • 4 Channel Native Audio Processing at 192kHZ
  • 30 kHz Audio Bandwidth for DTS-HD Compatibility
  • Energy Manager for Overall System Power Control
  • Eight Differential PWM Outputs
  • Separate Differential PWM Headphone Outputs w/Jack Detect

TAS5548 Audio Processing Functions Include:

  • Volume Control Range 18 dB to –127 dB 
  • Bass and Treble Tone Controls With ±18-dB  Range
  • Configurable Loudness Compensation

TAS5548 PWM Processing Specifications:

  • >105-dB Dynamic Range
  • THD+N < 0.1% (0–40 kHz)
  • 20-Hz–40-kHz, Flat Noise Floor for 32KHz – 192KHz
  • Auto-mute Logic for Noise-Free Operation

The Four TAS5342LA Amplifiers each provide the following specifications:

  • <0.1% THD+N (40W Peak @ 1Khz into 8 Ohms)
  • Over Temperature Warning and Error
  • Overload Protection 
  • Short-Circuit Protection 
  • PWM Activity Detector

The PI2MEDIA HT1 offers a true "out of the box" experience.  All you need is a power outlet and your favorite TV or Monitor!  Each unit ships with:
  • Fully assembled PI2MEDIA HT1 unit with either a 32GB (Streaming Edition), 250GB (Deluxe Edition) or 500GB (Server Edition) Solid State Drive
  • 8GB Micro-SD Card with NOOBS, set to boot OSMC® from SSD
  • Basic IR Remote Control
  • 12V @ 5A Power Supply with Universal Input for Worldwide operation
  • Micro-USB to USB-A Patch Cable
  • 3 Meter HDMI 1.4a Cable
  • Getting Started Instructions
  • 1 Year Warranty with unlimited email technical support

Well, yes, and no!  Most features of the PI2MEDIA HT1 are available in some form or another from a variety of other  companies.  Roku, Amazon-TV, Chromecast, etc all allow you to stream video from their list of network sources. There are external devices that will take an HDMI source and output 7.1 surround sound. FiveNinjas and others have taken the Raspberry Pi® Compute Module and created integrated streaming and serving boxes. And of course, many, many of you have bought a Raspberry Pi, added OSMC or Kodi and enjoyed the fruits (pun intended) of the Open Source support for the Pi.


The PI2MEDIA HT1 takes the streaming features of those closed commercial media players, adds the HDMI to surround sound output without an external device and combines it all with the Open Source software and support of the Raspberry Pi community, into one beautiful, compact, low-power, remote controllable, hackable, user update-able, affordable platform! While the default SBC used on the PI2MEDIA HT1 is the Raspberry PI® 2 Model B, planned (subject to change) alternate SBC options include the Odroid C2, which adds a higher performance 64-Bit ARM Quad Core CPU and Gigabit Ethernet, as well as the UP-Board with Intel x86 Quad Core and Gigabit Ethernet.


We are a small company located in the littlest state of Rhode Island USA!  Smaller than some ranches in Texas, but big in spirit.  We take our energy from the great college community here and the can do attitude of the typical New Englander!

Formed as a separate company from Cogent Computer Systems, Inc, we have been designing, developing and manufacturing sophisticated Microprocessor based products since 1992. In 2015 we formed Pi 2 Design in order to bring our expertise to the rapidly growing deployment of the Raspberry PI and other low cost SBC's into the embedded and home markets.  We also formed two brand names, PI2MEDIA and PI2EMBEDDED to show our support for these two great areas of application.  Our first product, the PI2EMBEDDED 502SSD Multi-Function shield was successfully funded on Kickstarter and is currently shipping to backers as we speak. The feedback we have already received has been very positive:

  • Received the shield last week... Works very well, quite a bit faster than a SanDisk Extreme USB3 stick. - Petr S.
  •  Received mine yesterday - quality looks awesome - very well packed to protect it from the dangers of USPS ;-).  George G.
  • I Just received the SSD Shield today, awesome.  Chris H.

Even when there are issues or questions, they are quickly answered and dealt with. For example, Our PSU supplier sent us non-compliant UK cables. When pointed out by a customer, we quickly took responsibility and put a replacement process in place. We're here for the long haul!

The 502SSD shield was also featured on several technology blogs and web sites including:



Even though we are taking proven Hardware IP and Open Source Software we need the initial volumes to help reduce the production cost per unit, as well as help cover the cost of software development. We are also asking for your help in refining the Open Source Software with your ideas and input. In addition to offering the standard skins per the OSMC® build, we will be accepting user generated skins that we could then deliver with the units.  We need your help as well in making sure we have this right!  Your feedback and comments (hopefully nice!) will help us refine the product before we go to production.

Finally, we are providing access to  the 502SSD and 502V2S shields and un-assembled case so you can build your own!

 

The PI2MEDIA HT1 is in the prototype stages now.  The PI2MEDIA HT1 has already been proven in the CSB502SSD and CSB502V2S shields as well as from other designs we've done.  The PI2MEDIA HT1 will use off the shelf, Open Source Software with minor patches and updates applied for the specific circuitry in the PI2MEDIA HT1.  Case design is wrapping up and everything will be ready for final production  testing in late March or early April.

Pi 2 Design does all production of the electronics on it's own IPC-610 Class 3 SMT Assembly Line.  Prototype machining is done using our in-house bench-top CNC Vertical Milling machine.


Raspberry Pi® is a trademark of the Raspberry Pi Foundation

OSMC® is a registered trademark of Sam Nazarko Trading Ltd

story:
Hi, welcome to my Indiegogo campaign for me to study abroad in Berlin for the summer 2015 through New York University’s Tisch School of Arts Multimedia Projects Workshop. My name is Joshan, as if I am just “joshing” with you, but not really, because it is actually my name!

As a Film & TV Production major at the University School of Cinematic Arts, I have the opportunity to expand my knowledge of filmmaking by working with other students from the top rated program at NYU. As a junior, I have been pondering whether I will work in the U.S.A. or abroad after graduation. With the opportunity to Study Abroad in the summer of 2015, I will have the opportunity to feel what it is like to live in a different country for an extended period.

The tuition, room & board to attend USC are approximately $65,000.00/year. In addition, the film and video production courses taken require substantial additional expenses beyond tuition. These expenses include lab fees for the course, stockroom cards, which must be purchased for using the School’s equipment, editing and camera supplies which each student must buy, and miscellaneous expenses such as props, gas for driving to locations, food for actors, and so on.

And, I’m not “joshing” you. It cost a great deal of money to attend USC and major in Film & TV Production. So, no pun intended based upon my name. I need your help raising $20,000.00!

My drive and commitment to excellence are exactly the characteristics I believe are sought-after for Hollywood’s success. I find adventure under every rock and use this grand sense of exploration to influence my filmmaking. I understand that the best films come from a filmmaker’s personal experiences. I desire to make fun and captivating movies and believe this comes from the filmmaker’s ability to have fun and experience life. On my deathbed one day, I would like to be able to smile pleasantly knowing I lived life to the fullest. I feel that by helping me study abroad, you will be making an investment in building and shaping a future leader.


About the Program - Multimedia Projects Workshop

With a young, creative population and an energetic, cosmopolitan art scene, Berlin has been enjoying a unique artistic revival that celebrates multimedia projects and unconventional spaces.  Students will have the opportunity to explore the city and to develop multimedia projects. The program features two complementary courses: Creative Computing and Live Video Performance Art.

From fine art to computer programming, from live performance to animation, this workshop has applications across disciplines.  There are no prerequisites, and the program welcomes students from all areas: e.g., film, music, computer science, dance, theater, fine art, multimedia, graphic design, performance art, photography etc.

(Source) 


Program Curriculum

Students will enroll in the following two courses for a total of 8 units.

Live Video Performance Art

This course will combine a history of video art and experimental film with practical training in the use of live video performance art technology. Students will explore new ways to create and edit films and videos using VJ software, projections, and multi-channel video surfaces. Workshops will demonstrate concepts and software that can be integrated into the creative process of video performance art and video art installations. Drawing inspiration from the recent history of video and multi-media artists, students will use live VJ software to manipulate digital media in real time as well as projection mapping techniques to project video art onto 3D surfaces in order to create original video art, video installations, and other performance pieces.

Creative Computing

What can computation add to human communication and creativity? Creating applications, instead of just using them, gives a us deeper understanding of the possibilities. Creating projects that you are excited about and invested in, whether the domain of art, design, performance, humanities, sciences, or engineering is the best way to learn the skills needed to realize those ideas. This course will begin with the expressive capabilities of the human body and how we experience our physical environment. The physical computing skills learned in this portion of the course will allow you to go past the limitations of the mouse, keyboard, and monitor interface to build your own, perhaps more expressive interfaces. The platform for the class is a micro-controller (Arduino brand), a very small inexpensive single-chip computer that can be embedded anywhere to both sense and create action in the physical world. The second portion of the course focuses on fundamentals of programming as well as more advanced techniques such as animation, image manipulation and processing, projection mapping, and computer vision. The Java-based ‘Processing’ programming environment is the primary vehicle that will be in use. Processing itself is oriented towards displays but can also connect back to the physical sensors and controllers from the first part of the class in order to create more applications with more expressive interfaces. The course is designed for computer programming novices but the project centered nature of it allows for more experienced programmers the opportunity to play further with their project ideas and make lots of friends by helping the other students.

(Source)


Cost Breakdown

·  Tuition & Fees - $12,000.00

·  Room - $1,500.00

·  Food - $1,500.00

·  Airfare - $2,500.00

·  Incidentals - $2,500.00


Insight into Joshan

The main crux of my producing goals is to provide proper representation for marginalized people through the power of cinema. This can range from producing content such like “Selma” or “12 Years A Slave” that shares the stories of the oppressed and a truer look of the past that is often romanticized.

However, I am also very interested in going a step further than that, and placing oppressed people in roles that are usually given to the privileged. For example, a black Indiana Jones or a Muslim woman being James Bond or a transgender Superman. These roles are traditionally given to people who fit the criteria for the most privileged of society. That being straight, white men. The roles of women are usually there only to advance the character development of the male protagonist or could easily be traded out for with a lamp.  The roles given to people of color, LGBT individuals, or people with disabilities are steeped in negative and damaging stereotypes that turn this marginalized group into a joke. Or, their roles are completely nonexistent. I want to change the traditional casting that exists in the entertainment industry.

My immediate goals are to produce projects at USC where proper representation is given. Sure, the audiences of these projects are small. However, the main audience would be my classmates who are trying to go into the entertainment industry. By educating, those about proper representation will make them more socially conscious filmmakers. They will move up the ranks of the entertainment industry with a ground firm base of socially awareness and will reach positions in the future where they understand that the past practices of Hollywood are unacceptable.

I also desire to build a network of filmmakers and artists of other mediums who are already educated on social issues and share similar goals or proper representation. By building this stronghold, we can venture into the industry, hand in hand, fighting the good fight to fix the wrongs of the media.

My long-term goals are really about maintaining proper representation in my work and all the projects I desire to work. I want to work in children’s media because I feel that is the area of the media where representation is most important. By including harmful stereotypes and the lack of representation in children’s TV and movies, we are teaching them racism, sexism, and homophobia and a slew of other ideas that will be internalized in the minds of children. By putting a higher standard on what we show our children will assure that events and situations, such like Ferguson, will not happen because we will live in a world where the privilege/oppression dichotomy is not taught to be the norm of how society runs.

I also want to give back! I want to create infrastructure that allows more diverse creators to have their work shown. In the current Hollywood system, it is rather difficult for creators who are not straight white men to get the work recognized. I want to create a way for anyone to be able to get their foot in the door so that they may color the black and white vision of Hollywood!


Thank You!

Thank you for visiting my campaign page. Please consider donating by reading through the various Perks of donating!

cosmopolitan art scene, Berlin has been enjoying a unique artistic revival that
celebrates multimedia projects and unconventional spaces.  Students will have the opportunity to explore
the city and to develop multimedia projects. The program features two
complementary courses: Creative Computing and Live Video Performance Art. 
From fine art to computer programming, from live
performance to animation, this workshop has applications across
disciplines.  There are no prerequisites,
and the program welcomes students from all areas: e.g., film, music, computer
science, dance, theater, fine art, multimedia, graphic design, performance art,
photography etc.
(Source)  Program Curriculum
Students will enroll in the following two courses
for a total of 8 units.
Live Video
Performance Art
This course will combine a history of video art and
experimental film with practical training in the use of live video performance
art technology. Students will explore new ways to create and edit films and
videos using VJ software, projections, and multi-channel video surfaces.
Workshops will demonstrate concepts and software that can be integrated into
the creative process of video performance art and video art installations.
Drawing inspiration from the recent history of video and multi-media artists,
students will use live VJ software to manipulate digital media in real time as
well as projection mapping techniques to project video art onto 3D surfaces in
order to create original video art, video installations, and other performance
pieces.
Creative
Computing
What can computation add to human communication and
creativity? Creating applications, instead of just using them, gives a us
deeper understanding of the possibilities. Creating projects that you are
excited about and invested in, whether the domain of art, design, performance,
humanities, sciences, or engineering is the best way to learn the skills needed
to realize those ideas. This course will begin with the expressive capabilities
of the human body and how we experience our physical environment. The physical
computing skills learned in this portion of the course will allow you to go
past the limitations of the mouse, keyboard, and monitor interface to build
your own, perhaps more expressive interfaces. The platform for the class is a
micro-controller (Arduino brand), a very small inexpensive single-chip computer
that can be embedded anywhere to both sense and create action in the physical
world. The second portion of the course focuses on fundamentals of programming
as well as more advanced techniques such as animation, image manipulation and
processing, projection mapping, and computer vision. The Java-based
‘Processing’ programming environment is the primary vehicle that will be in
use. Processing itself is oriented towards displays but can also connect back
to the physical sensors and controllers from the first part of the class in
order to create more applications with more expressive interfaces. The course
is designed for computer programming novices but the project centered nature of
it allows for more experienced programmers the opportunity to play further with
their project ideas and make lots of friends by helping the other students.
(Source)
Cost Breakdown
· 
Tuition & Fees - $12,000.00
· 
Room - $1,500.00
· 
Food - $1,500.00
· 
Airfare - $2,500.00
· 
Incidentals - $2,500.00
Insight into Joshan
The main crux of my producing
goals is to provide proper representation for marginalized people through the
power of cinema. This can range from producing content such like “Selma” or “12
Years A Slave” that shares the stories of the oppressed and a truer look of the
past that is often romanticized. 
However, I am also very
interested in going a step further than that, and placing oppressed people in
roles that are usually given to the privileged. For example, a black Indiana
Jones or a Muslim woman being James Bond or a transgender Superman. These roles
are traditionally given to people who fit the criteria for the most privileged
of society. That being straight, white men. The roles of women are usually
there only to advance the character development of the male protagonist or
could easily be traded out for with a lamp. 
The roles given to people of color, LGBT individuals, or people with
disabilities are steeped in negative and damaging stereotypes that turn this
marginalized group into a joke. Or, their roles are completely nonexistent. I
want to change the traditional casting that exists in the entertainment
industry.
My immediate goals are to produce
projects at USC where proper representation is given. Sure, the audiences of
these projects are small. However, the main audience would be my classmates who
are trying to go into the entertainment industry. By educating, those about
proper representation will make them more socially conscious filmmakers. They
will move up the ranks of the entertainment industry with a ground firm base of
socially awareness and will reach positions in the future where they understand
that the past practices of Hollywood are unacceptable. 
I also desire to build a network
of filmmakers and artists of other mediums who are already educated on social
issues and share similar goals or proper representation. By building this
stronghold, we can venture into the industry, hand in hand, fighting the good
fight to fix the wrongs of the media. 
My long-term goals are really
about maintaining proper representation in my work and all the projects I
desire to work. I want to work in children’s media because I feel that is the
area of the media where representation is most important. By including harmful
stereotypes and the lack of representation in children’s TV and movies, we are
teaching them racism, sexism, and homophobia and a slew of other ideas that will
be internalized in the minds of children. By putting a higher standard on what
we show our children will assure that events and situations, such like
Ferguson, will not happen because we will live in a world where the
privilege/oppression dichotomy is not taught to be the norm of how society
runs. 
I also want to give back! I want to create
infrastructure that allows more diverse creators to have their work shown. In
the current Hollywood system, it is rather difficult for creators who are not
straight white men to get the work recognized. I want to create a way for
anyone to be able to get their foot in the door so that they may color the
black and white vision of Hollywood!
Thank You!
Thank you for visiting my campaign page. Please
consider donating by reading through the various Perks of donating!

story:
The Nomad project TEAM

We are Natalia & Adrián, two artists based in Barcelona. We started this project in 2016, with the loyal belief that art is a tool for social transformation and social inclusion.​

Natalia is an architect by profession, artist by passion and a faithful believer in a better world.

She has participated in several projects of thinking about the city, in Cali (Colombia) her native city and now in Barcelona, where she has demonstrated her ability to work with the community wherever she lives.

Her experience of life in different countries, such as France and Spain, has led her to become interested in educational processes through art that can be shared throughout the world. This is why she has decided to participate in the Nomad Project as Manager.

Adrián is convinced that art can help people to change their reality, as well as developing their psychological and social skills.

Creativity is the resource that he uses the most in his life, his two major passions are as a Chef and an artist, and this is key for for his work. He thinks that art brings another appreciation of reality and that it helps to build a future. He has collaborated in several groups of artists in the city of Barcelona, organizing many exhibitions of art. 

​

​​​​What is our goal?​

Our main goal is to promote art as a tool to improve creativity in the human being through artistic mediation, which is art as a tool for social transformation, social inclusion and community work. So, we are interested in finding a common structure in artistic disciplines that allows us to enjoy the virtues of creativity, more than in the technical part of the artistic practice.​

In this way, we want to show how an artistic workshop contributes in people living in situations of vulnerability or social exclusion. From the creative capacity that we all have, we want to escape from the stereotyped way of looking.  

By developing the capacity to create of each one of the participants, we can improve people's self esteem to empower the person that, then, will be able to work in community. So, in a community, the artistic workshop allows a community empowerment.  ​​

Art acts as a way of expression that permits to the participant to surpass his own difficulties, becoming resilient, which is the capacity to get pasta an adversity, so we can say that the artistic mediation develops resilience both, in a personal and community level.  ​

Finally, as a platform, we want to raise awareness about the problems we will work on, by making visible those situations through our virtual community and, when we will have the opportunity, through art shows.​

 

How do we do that?​

We realize artistic workshops in the communities for at least 15 days to develop the capacity to create of each one of the participants, allowing the everybody to express itself in the way they prefer. ​

During this period we realize a singular experience, one in which we develop the creativity and the imagination in order to awake interest in new fields and to discover alternative ways of thinking.​

The participants of the workshop, work actively and totally absorbed in several exercises that promote different areas, reviving interest and imagination, using activities that range across dynamics, games, and some artistic techniques, transforming the workshop, in a real didactic experience for the creative process.

 

Workshops

We develop our workshops as a didactic experience for the creative process, which takes form in different ways, from playing to creating, to generating a space where communication becomes the most important aspect and where it is possible to develop both a social and emotional intelligence with a collective creativity.​​

The environment of the workshop allows to the participants to acquire the aptitude of decision, required to develop their own creative process. The design of the workshops develops an environment to exercise techniques of expression graphic and manual arts, these ways of expression are the elements that constructs our methodology.​

Our period with each community is divided in three phases: Motivations and priorities, Senses and Environment.

We divide our Workshop in three blocks ​:

  • Introduction
  • Phase of action
  • Phase of communication

To know more about them you can check out our website.

 

For what do we need the money?

The communities we will be visiting in this action live in situations of vulnerability and for a lot of them this will be a first experience with  artistic practice and materials. Also, we want to be able to do our internal routes and to pay our accommodation during the workshop days. That is why we want to provide them with high quality artistic materials, books and even computers if is possible, to be able to teach them some digital processes as photography and video. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

As our starting point is ART, we decided to use it to fund our project. That is why in our website you can find donated artworks that you can purchase to help fund this project.(http://www.nomad-project.org/solidarity-auction)

Artists from all over the world are collaborating with us to make this project possible: from England, India, Colombia, Uruguay and even Japan. They are working to make this dream a reality!

>>>Start bidding in our website>>>

story:
Short Summary

Hundreds of our partner schools across Africa are slowly taking the first steps toward the Digital Revolution.  They have computers, tablets, and phones that allow students to read e-books and journals, but they lack the reliable internet service needed to access the materials.  We want to change that.

The Theological Book Network has - in its 11 years of operation - shipped over 1.9 million books to over 1,300 Christian colleges, universities, and seminaries in 86 countries, all from our headquarters in Grand Rapids, Michigan.

With your help, we will be able to extend this work by providing thousands of digital materials including theological books, journals, video presentations, and audio lectures to students training to be the next generation of Christian pastors, professors, and leaders at 25 schools across Africa.


What We Need & What You Get

  • The Theological Book Network is seeking $15,000 to acquire and curate thousands of books and audio-visual resources, load them onto hard drives, and ship them to our partner schools.  
  • These funds will help pay for the hard drives and shipping costs.
  • We are happy to provide perks for participation, based on your level of contribution.
  • If we do not reach our funding goal, we will provide as many hard drives as we are able with the funds collected.


The Impact

  • Christianity is growing quickly throughout Africa.  In 1910, only 9.1% of the population of sub-Saharan Africa identified as Christian.  By 2010, that percentage had exploded to 62.7%. 
  • Many communities have responded to this growth by establishing Christian colleges and seminaries, but these institutions often lack the high-quality academic theological resources their students and faculties need.  This project will help address that need.
  • With the average library acquisitions budget for our partner schools in Africa standing at less than $100 per year, most libraries hold fewer books than make up a Western scholar’s personal library.
  • Your gift will allow us to not only improve the quality of these libraries, but provide access to digital resources that will go a long way in meeting the learning needs of students, faculty, and clergy.


Risks & Challenges

While shipping to our partners in the Global South does have its challenges, the Theological Book Network has 11 years of successfully shipping books and other resources to our partner schools.  We have a network of hundreds of theological schools throughout sub-Saharan Africa, and will thoughtfully select the schools best able to utilize these materials.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word!!!  The more people that know about the Theological Book Network and this project, the better.  Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and through emails!
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary


  • Hi, my name is Claudia van Zuiden. I have worked in Nepal with various humanitarian projects over the years, and have seen that some money given to NGOs does not always reach the people who it is meant for.
  • After the devastion caused by the earthquake that happened on Saturday 25th April, Nepal is in need of so many things urgently, People have asked me how they can help but they don't know which charities to donate their money to.
  • There are many good charities out there such as Oxfam and Red Cross, however if you would like to know exactly where you helping, please donate here!


What We Need & What You Get

This is what you get:

  • The promise that ALL donations given to the Nepal Earthquake Relief FUND will be going to different emergency relief projects, such as hospitals, woman and children support charities and  mental health projects. 

What we need:

  • Initially we hope to raise £ 3000 and we will let you know what money is given to which project. We will be transparent and feel free to ask any questions about where your donations will be spend on.
  • One of our friends in Nepal, is sending money directly to two hospitals in Pokhara and we will give money to him so he can give it directly to the hospitals.
  • Another friend is looking for tents through the GlobalMentalHealth project, we are hoping to provide these too.
  • Other projects might become part of this funding and we will certainly update you about this as soon as we know more ourselves.

The Impact

By donation to this CAUSE your money will go directly to the people who need it!

I have previously worked in Nepal with the people who are coordinating these different humanitarian projects we are hoping to support. We totally trust that your money will go to where it is needed most, such as hospitals,

Your donation will make a direct impact on someones life so please give what you can! 


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are not able to contribute,  that doesn't mean that you can't help:

    • Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools when you do! Thanks so much!



    Photocredit: www.ibtimes.co.uk 

    and Dorje Lama

story:
Short Summery

I am Abigail, a homeschool mom in Malta, Europe. Homeschooling is finally being legalized in the coming weeks and we need your help. There are no resources what so ever on the island and we are looking to open a lending library with some curricula and how-to books that will be available to all the moms who would want to homeschool in the coming years. Right now we are a group of 7 moms with about 20 kids between us but we are expecting that number to grow very rapidly in the next scholastic year. We get all our material online but that means that we have to spend a lot of time putting material together ourselves. Postage is also very expensive and we cannot cover it without your help

What We Need 

  • We will be using the funds collected to purchase used books from other homeschool moms who are willing to post abroad. 
  • Most of the funds will go to paying for postage of the material we collect. 
  • We are also asking homeschoolers to contact us if you wish to donate some of your material, books or manipulatives too.
  • We are also accepting any .pdf material too. We will use some of the funding to print them out.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this page with all your homeschool friends, blogs and other people that may be interested in helping us in one way or other
  • We are all accepting your prayers, in this time of transition we are expecting some challenges as we learn to abide by the regulations set for us. We are praying that between our collection of Material and a small Coop group we set up already, the Education Department would see our motives are right and that it would help us gain their trust. It has been a long fight to earn our right to Homeschool and many are still very sceptical. 

Our (Very Basic) Wishlist we would appreciate other books too :)


math u see

science in the beginning

a child's book of character building

the homeschooling handbook

berenstain books

exploring creation by apologia

pocket full of pinecones

charlotte mason (collection excluding Vol 1)

charlotte mason companion

penmenship by horizons of abeka

five in a row

magic schoolbus

trail guide of world geography

educating the whole hearted child

little house on the praire
