story: 1

Hi,

Thanks for taking your time to view the video about our organization. I am a 13-year veteran of the United States Army with multiple tours to Iraq and Afghanistan. I have seen too many veterans lose access to their educational benefits they were promised when enlisting in our armed forces. These men and women have deployed to locations across the globe while giving personal sacrifice by leaving behind their families and giving up much of their adult life. 

Sequestration and extreme budget cuts are placing harsh restraints on the educational benefits these men and women enlisted to receive. It's our duty to ensure these heroes are properly educated.

Regardless if a veteran completes two or 20 years of service, they depart the armed forces with a plethora of skills and knowledge that is instrumental to the civilian sector. Their knowledge and experience combined with a college education could significantly improve our economy when our veterans enter the civilian workforce. 

Our mission is provide educational grants to service members and veterans of the United States Military in order to improve quality of life for veterans and their families. 

Our goals are to:

- keep administrative costs to a minimum and master bootstrapping

- receive 501(c)3 status

- provide grants to service members and veterans

- improve quality of life and the U.S. economy

All donors will be providing funds for educational grants in trade, undergraduate, graduate, doctorate, and professional studies. Our request for $13,392.75 is for our foundation to provide educational grants and cover the minute administrative and legal fees required for start-up.

Donors who offer $1,000 or more will receive the name of their family or organization to our organizational website (once launched) and donors who offer $5,000 or more will receive the name of their family or organization to our organizational website (once launched) and a plaque at our future office. 

We are grateful for donations of all sizes and thank you for taking your time with us today.

"Educate Veterans, Improve Quality of Life"

Michael Barbera

Executive Director

Ed Vet Inc.

story:
8th Grade Washington DC Trip

I have an opportunity to go to Washington DC with some of the 8th grade class for 4 days and 3 nights.

My mom and dad are having me earn the money for my trip by spending the summer working.  Some of the jobs I am doing are babysitting, dog walking, dog sitting, lemonade stand and possibly a garage sale.  I really need help toward paying for my trip.  I am willing to work but I won't make enough to pay for the trip.

 

Below is the link to USA Student Travel where you can get more of an idea of all the great things I will be doing on the trip.  It's such a great opportunity for me I hope you can help out.

http://www.usastudenttravel.com/

Thank You,

Lauren Whittaker

story:
HELP THE KIDS!

 

Mosaic Arts Center (MAC) is where West Valley, Maricopa County, AZ kids and parents use art projects to learn Science, Technology, Engineering and Math.  There is no place like this in the West Valley.  We are making a difference; we see “light bulbs” turn on with every class.   

We are open and local kids and parents connect us with the community in ways that make it possible to “kid-test” what we do. We are finding out which art projects best teach Science, Technology, Engineering and Math in ways that meet Arizona Science Education Standards.

We are unique. Our President, Marty Wesolowski, was one of the original designers and developers for the AZ Science Center in Phoenix.  Stocked with Marty-made, hands-on museum grade teaching exhibits, people to teach how each works, “maker-space” where kids and adults can create their own and a stage where they can show-off what they learned. There is nothing like The MAC.

Donors like The City of Avondale, Goodmans Interior Structures, Troon Golf, others and our own sweat equity transformed an abandoned building into a comfortable art-project based Science, Technology, Engineering and Math learning center. It currently costs about $2,000/month to keep the doors open and later this summer we will be paying an additional $1700 for rent. Grants have been applied for and we have an after-school program contract but revenue has not kept up with costs and we are operating out of our pockets.

MAC needs the generosity of people like you.  $20,000 will buy time to secure enough revenue to keep the doors open: And the gratuities you will receive in return for your generosity will make you smile.
